revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 19:09:52.000000000', 'message': "Add pep8 import order validation

Add the flake8-import-order library to our test requirements so that we
can avoid these PEP8 violations and maintain consistent import ordering.
Also fix our violations.

This library is in requirements but is blacklisted from being
automatically updated since it is never shipped. For now, don't bother
to pin it.

Change-Id: I4e788292b98b7f2f835cc80081763b2d249fe43e
"}]
commit_message:
Add pep8 import order validation

Add the flake8-import-order library to our test requirements so that we
can avoid these PEP8 violations and maintain consistent import ordering.
Also fix our violations.

This library is in requirements but is blacklisted from being
automatically updated since it is never shipped. For now, don't bother
to pin it.

Change-Id: I4e788292b98b7f2f835cc80081763b2d249fe43e

(5 comments)

mriedem said:
> should also provide a way to do traits-based filtering on things 
> like multiattach volume bfv and tagged boot from volume.

This and L47 have me confused - where do traits come into play?  This spec talks about aggregates.

Though IMO, using traits for this could be at least as elegant - see comment on L119.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:29:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Still +2; Dan is going to update with a link to the dependent spec for the GET /allocation_candidates?member_of= stuff, but I'm still happy with what is proposed here."}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Thanks for doing this. It would surely have a positive impact on the performance in huge clouds.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Wording looks good.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-15 11:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

Fine as is, some queries within about alternatives and reasoning and some comments here.

Before I vote, though, two things. One is simply that I don't want to be all "woot go" on a thing that's a day old, I want to think about it (as there's no immediate rush is there?). The other is:

It feels like there's a latent need for a conversation to provide some rules of thumb on:

* when to use nested
* when to use traits
* when to use aggregates

It's often the case that each can be made to work but which is ideal in any case depends. In this particular case placement-aggregates seems like they make sense because nova-aggregates are already in use. And that's probably good enough for a let's do it.

But if we step back and look at the bigger picture, we can reflect on some of the ways we could have done things (for example modelling cell mappings in placement itself with cell resource providers as parents of compute nodes), and what that could mean for how we might do things in the future.

And just to be clear: I'm not saying we should change anything, or do anything differently now, or that we did anything wrong in the past or that the alternatives were even possible in the past. Just that reflecting on the options is good for making sure we know what the options are for the future.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-15 16:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-15 16:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-02-15 16:50:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(10 comments)

I'm basically okay with that spec and I reinforced some things I consider crucial (the fact that we possibly need to handle Placement API microversions hence not something open to operators as a pluggable mechanism) but I have one question about persistence of augmented RequestSpec before +2ing that spec."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-15 16:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

ok, thanks for your patience in letting me read through this. I'm good with it.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-15 18:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-02-15 18:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2018-02-15 22:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Thanks Dan,
in my opinion the scheduling problem of cellsV2 for large deployments is well described by this spec. 
This concern was always present early in cellsV2 developement, but to be fair at that point placement was also in design phase and we didn't had a clear idea about it. 
For example: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-cells-scheduling-requirements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141486/8 


I would like to explain how we use cellsV1 and how we currently map requests to cells to better expose the current issue.

Cells are used as failure domains (maximum ~200 nodes per cell), to segregate hardware types in general, specific use cases (batch processing, Ironic nodes, GPUs, special configurations, ...) and generic use cases (where AVZs are exposed)

To map requests to cells we use cell scheduler filters.
I made them available at: https://gitlab.cern.ch/belmiro/cellsv1-filters

My understanding is that the solution proposed can be extended with other "request filters" to cover more use cases.
However one of my concerns is that we are mapping cells to aggregates. When having a cloud with several thousand nodes, managing aggregates is extremelly complicated.

Our use cases that are handled by the cell scheduler filters:
- A project can be mapped to one or several cells. And a cell can have several projects mapped. 
See: target_cell_project.py

- If a project is not mapped to a cell the request goes to a default set of cells. Where the AVZs are exposed. An AVZ is a set of cells.
See: target_cell_avz.py

- To simplify what is exposed to the users we only have 5 AVZs. An AVZ is a set of cells. And a cell has only one hardware type (usually an hardware delivery). This means that per AVZ we can have different hardware types that have for example a different CPU/RAM ratio. Because of that we "white list" the flavors that can be used in each of these cells to better use the hardware available. 
See: target_cell_flavor.py


In all these cases the cell-scheduler selects a cell considering the use case. And selecting a cell is extremelly fast. 
Then is the local nova-scheduler (maximum of ~200 nodes) that applies the sub set of scheduler-filters that makes sense for that particular cell.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-15 22:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Cleanup the manage-volumes admin doc

This was originaly copied over from "compute-manage-volumes.rst"
doc in the openstack-manuals repo but it's clearly mostly talking
about managing volumes on the Cinder side, not how they related
to compute server instances. Furthermore, Cinder already has a much
more detailed CLI guide on managing volumes, so this change removes
the content that's not specific to Nova and just links to the Cinder
docs.

Change-Id: I8e1c0d30debfdd4017c6d1a810a7b7dd382cd02d

commit_message:
Add symlink for zip file generation

Windows batch files are now created using st.py, not osbash.sh. The
resulting files land in labs/wbatch where they are not found by
tools/generate-labs.

This patch adds a symlink in order to have st.py write the Windows
batch files where they are expected.

Change-Id: Ife23887481d2e30e6e1e15992f5eb86de7c76e36

commit_message:
Add symlink for zip file generation

Windows batch files are now created using st.py, not osbash.sh. The
resulting files land in labs/wbatch where they are not found by
tools/generate-labs.

This patch adds a symlink in order to have st.py write the Windows
batch files where they are expected.

Change-Id: Ife23887481d2e30e6e1e15992f5eb86de7c76e36

commit_message:
Remove useless manifest file

PBR by default gets most files in the repo itself
so a manifest file isn't needed.

"MANIFEST.in generation ensures almost all files
stored in Git, with the exception of .gitignore,
.gitreview and .pyc files, are automatically
included in your distribution."

Change-Id: I5a3dd88e92eee6d7f28d3578e412689fa1f729f4

commit_message:
Grant admin a role on the system during bootstrap

Now that we have system scope in place, we should make sure at least
one user has a role assignment on the system. We can do this at the
same time we grant the user a role on a project during bootstrap.

This is backwards compatible because even if a deployment doesn't use
system-scope, the assignment will just sit there. The deployment will
have to opt into enforcing scope by updating configuration options
for oslo.policy to enforce scoping.

This shouldn't prevent deployments from fixing bug 968696 and using
system scope.

Closes-Bug: 1749268

Change-Id: I6b7196a28867d9a699716c8fef2609d608a5b2a2
(cherry picked from commit 3c524e6491c1b35a2f8413ebe046c238bf530d71)

commit_message:
Fix querying role_assignment with system roles

This commit removes system role assignments when querying keystone
for a list of assignments pertaining to a specific role. For example,
`GET /v3/role_assignments?role.id={role_id}`, now returns assignments
only for that role. Previously, the list contained false positives
because some system role assignments weren't being removed. This
was introduced in queens with the system scope work.

Change-Id: Iab35ae01bb715da5813e62cd09900de555dceaaa
Closes-Bug: 1748970
(cherry picked from commit 8748e729b2f139c245316fcece181625978c70a1)

commit_message:
Bump u-c for tinyrpc

currently specified verison 0.7 has disappeared from PyPI [0],
and thus fresh DevStack deployments fail while installing Neutron.

[0] https://pypi.python.org/simple/tinyrpc/

Change-Id: Id4595b050ad916b11d671add1111d0b7e3c77aff

commit_message:
undercloud: introduce deployment_user parameter

deployment_user is a new parameter, default to getpass.getuser(),
will feed DeploymentUser parameter in THT, primarly used to add the
user to the 'docker' group, so our operators can run the `overcloud
container` commands when the undercloud is containerized.

Right now, the docker group was modified in puppet with
instack-undercloud but with the heat-installer we want to do it in
tripleoclient. DeploymentUser was chosen to be "standard" and can be
used for both undercloud & overclouds notions.

Change-Id: Ia5cc7b34ebee8cf2f49300ce23050370d5f1038a

commit_message:
DVR: Fix dvr_no_external agent restart with fips

Centralized floating IP return to Error state when
the 'dvr_no_external' agent restarts.
The sync data received from the server was not handling
the agent properly and so was not update the 'dvr_snat_bound'
flag.
This would initiate an floating IP Error state.
This patch will fix the issue mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1741411
Change-Id: Id1cf26ffba8262ba7b3e5f41faa4cb28ba9dcb7d

Change DPD action policy to restart for VIP tunnels

Using hold was blocking the connection when a VIP failover happens.

commit_message:
URI filtering for web-download

Implement URI filtering to prevent port scanning with the web-download
Image import method.

(cherry picked from commit 1591f573ae20037c8b87ca6c331e8e5ce4f77a0a)

commit_message:
Remove PYTHONHASHSEED setting

The previous patch set PYTHONHASHSEED=0 to deal with some hash
difference issues in tests. Long-term we want it to be on. This patch
should let us iterate on finding andy remaining ordering assumptions
in the tests.

Change-Id: Ic8703f588506f525779d48e23d0d931c2b3cb33b

commit_message:
libvirt: remove TODO on validation of scsi model

We've already validated scsi model in
nova.object.fields.SCSIModelField()

Change-Id: I2b164515368d4680f37a6e9f2d4328bebf5680ed
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

commit_message:
Add some comments explaining split_loggers flag logic

split_loggers can be None, True or False, but there are no comments
explaining why or what is happening. Explain ourselves.

Change-Id: I6ccc2cd44f388c7c9d6d63b239a9f5f068c9cbfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-20 18:01:05.000000000', 'message': "Split request logging into four different loggers

Python logging is pretty amazingly flexible, and allows us to emit
to arbitrary logging domains so that a consumer can direct log output
with specificity.

Turning on HTTP debug logging currently produces an avalanche of output,
when sometimes just seeing that the requests were made and responded to
is perfectly fine.

Split the loggers used into four - one for request ids, one for request
commands, one for response headers and one for response body content.
Make them subloggers of keystoneauth1.session so that if a user does nothing,
their existing logging config will be unchanged.

If someone passes in a logger, behave as before logging all things to
the provided logger.

While we're at it, document this in the using-sessions document, so that
people know that the loggers exist and what they do.

Change-Id: Ide7dac8adf5c76c9019c35867cda632aff39770f
"}, {'created': '2017-09-20 20:47:18.000000000', 'message': "Split request logging into four different loggers

is perfectly fine.

Split the loggers used into four - one for request ids, one for request
commands, one for response headers and one for response body content.
Make them subloggers of keystoneauth1.session so that if a user does nothing,
their existing logging config will be unchanged.

If someone passes in a logger, behave as before logging all things to
the provided logger.

While we're at it, document this in the using-sessions document, so that

"}, {'created': '2017-09-22 21:16:12.000000000', 'message': "Split request logging into four different loggers

Python logging is pretty amazingly flexible, and allows us to emit
to arbitrary logging domains so that a consumer can direct log output
with specificity.

Turning on HTTP debug logging currently produces an avalanche of output,
when sometimes just seeing that the requests were made and responded to
is perfectly fine.

Split the loggers used into four - one for request ids, one for request
commands, one for response headers and one for response body content.
Make them subloggers of keystoneauth1.session so that if a user does nothing,
their existing logging config will be unchanged.

If someone passes in a logger, behave as before logging all things to
the provided logger.

commit_message:
Split request logging into four different loggers

Python logging is pretty amazingly flexible, and allows us to emit
to arbitrary logging domains so that a consumer can direct log output
with specificity.

Turning on HTTP debug logging currently produces an avalanche of output,
when sometimes just seeing that the requests were made and responded to
is perfectly fine.

Split the loggers used into four - one for request ids, one for request
commands, one for response headers and one for response body content.
Make them subloggers of keystoneauth.session so that if a user does nothing,
their existing logging config will be unchanged.

If someone passes in a logger, behave as before logging all things to
the provided logger.

While we're at it, document this in the using-sessions document, so that
people know that the loggers exist and what they do.

NOTE:
The tox (>=1.7.0) by default sets a random python hash seed which
causes ordering of dicts and sets to be different between tests runs.
Disabled the random python hash seed by setting PYTHONHASHSEED=0 to
fix the random failure of below test:

keystoneauth1.tests.unit.test_session.SessionAuthTests.
test_split_loggers

The PYTHONHASHSEED=0 is removed in the followup patch so that we can
separate the tracking down of ordering issues in tests from this patch.

Change-Id: Ide7dac8adf5c76c9019c35867cda632aff39770f

messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-02-15 20:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nI'll do a separate fix for haproxy, keepalived. The last reason for this patch no longer applies"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 22:22:01.000000000', 'message': "Refactor building undercloud env files

This cleans up the code a bit and allows an extra check that the
environment file really exists.

This includes a fix for haproxy and keepalived environments which
didn't have the tht prefix included.

Finally, this change is required so there is a more structured
environment file list to pass to the container image prepare call.

Change-Id: Ie5f230fc26be2303297dce52dca612dc3c71cbb4
Blueprint: containerized-undercloud
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor building undercloud env files

This cleans up the code a bit and allows an extra check that the
environment file really exists.

This includes a fix for haproxy and keepalived environments which
didn't have the tht prefix included.

Finally, this change is required so there is a more structured
environment file list to pass to the container image prepare call.

Change-Id: Ie5f230fc26be2303297dce52dca612dc3c71cbb4
Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

commit_message:
Updates API for deleting "DELETED" objects

This patch fixes the API to return a 204 for object delete calls on objects
already in the "DELETED" provisioning_status.

It also enables a few API tests that were marked for "skip" but are now valid.

Story: 2001537
Task: 6344
(cherry picked from commit 2d206289d005737d87f7712ba443a345d5547b18)

Change-Id: I6a307b76239f8098243621c06451e39a7e807ce9

commit_message:
Bump u-c for tinyrpc

currently specified verison 0.7 has disappeared from PyPI [0],
and thus fresh DevStack deployments fail while installing Neutron.

[0] https://pypi.python.org/simple/tinyrpc/

Change-Id: Id4595b050ad916b11d671add1111d0b7e3c77aff
(cherry picked from commit 8c314d04f9df45b00353751eff02d68bb3862f91)

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-21 15:00:48.000000000', 'message': "firewall: stop using stdlib stages

Using Puppet stdlib in TripleO is risky because it exposes deployments
to dependency cycles in the catalog.
We should rather use native functions to make orchestrations, like
ordering and dependencies management.

This patch:

- removes usage of stages from stdlib
- use ordering to make sure we run pre rules before post
- use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
  rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
  services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database
  or amqp)
- use dependencies to make sure we create regular rules after pre and
  before post steps.

Change-Id: Iec4705d6b785a40ccf6f43809b94b726ccd47fef
Closes-Bug: #1643575
"}, {'created': '2016-11-21 19:24:33.000000000', 'message': "firewall: stop using stdlib stages

Using Puppet stdlib in TripleO is risky because it exposes deployments
to dependency cycles in the catalog.
We should rather use native functions to make orchestrations, like
ordering and dependencies management.

This patch:

- removes usage of stages from stdlib
- use ordering to make sure we run pre rules before post
- use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
  rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
  services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database
  or amqp)

Change-Id: Iec4705d6b785a40ccf6f43809b94b726ccd47fef
Closes-Bug: #1643575
"}]
commit_message:
firewall: stop using stdlib stages

Using Puppet stdlib in TripleO is risky because it exposes deployments
to dependency cycles in the catalog.
We should rather use native functions to make orchestrations, like
ordering and dependencies management.

This patch:

- removes usage of stages from stdlib
- use ordering to make sure we run pre rules before post
- use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
  rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
  services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database
  or amqp)

Change-Id: Iec4705d6b785a40ccf6f43809b94b726ccd47fef
Closes-Bug: #1643575

commit_message:
Add default value for CONF.auth.admin_domain_name

It's a bit confusing for the users who are not so familiar
with keystone v3 to configure the value of CONF.auth.admin_domain_name,
so better to provide a default value for this config item,
which can work in most environments.

Change-Id: I21705f6c4966e507e31201e3efe6d0d593526020

commit_message:
Reduce console output in CI jobs

This patch adds rsync options to the log synchronization task that
should reduce the amount of lines showing up in the main conosle
log. This should make it a bit easier to find the failure lines
in CI runs.

Change-Id: Ie73cf21f15a51047c1adda27dd1d9f17cc103cee

commit_message:
Enable mariadb and rabbitmq exporters for armada deployment

This enables prometheus monitoring for rabbitmq and mariadb in
the armada gate, as the armada gate has deployed prometheus and
can be used to verify functionality

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Update openstacksdk links to be accurate

python-openstacksdk publishes to the normal doc location. Update the
links to point to it, and add a redirect for anyone with a link pointing
to the old location that was in developer.openstack.org. Also update the
link to the shade docs.

Change-Id: I6d3eb2e23fbb6c35a19113ec1c00ffd07360feed

commit_message:
Remove unused class variables from token provider

These two were just chillin' as token provider class variables. They
are not used anywhere and we use special notification strings defined
in notification.py for good reason. Keeping things defined in one
place makes maintenance easier. Remove the unused variabels from the
token provider.

Change-Id: I98f29114daa01df94f12813143da9097c294b43a

messages: [{'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-02-07 22:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-02-08 03:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 22:18:35.000000000', 'message': "mariadb: remove connect_timeout to fix mysqldump

Remove 'connect_timeout' which defined in the '[client]' section which
surprisingly affects mysqldump by causing it to fail as it doesn't
understand this; we're not doing anything that depends on having this
value so this is safe.

This now means mysqldump works (as expected) and we can use the
packaged/pod version of mysqldump for backup purposes.

Change-Id: I9142969e4b8576b19353c063586dd11f91875f0b
LocalWords:  mysqldump
"}]
commit_message:
mariadb: remove connect_timeout to fix mysqldump

Remove 'connect_timeout' which defined in the '[client]' section which
surprisingly affects mysqldump by causing it to fail as it doesn't
understand this; we're not doing anything that depends on having this
value so this is safe.

This now means mysqldump works (as expected) and we can use the
packaged/pod version of mysqldump for backup purposes.

Change-Id: I9142969e4b8576b19353c063586dd11f91875f0b
LocalWords:  mysqldump

commit_message:
Unify the Cinder HA and non-HA docker configurations

Relocate the list of docker volumes used by the CinderVolume and
CinderBackup services so that a common list can be used in both HA and
non-HA deployments. For HA, the list is passed to puppet-tripleo via
hiera data.

Closes-Bug: #1748290
Depends-On: I4ba0d78ad17183b97290b853a6c103e55bc8977c
Change-Id: I41d6ff1dc60a799cec18fbeb64c8b63961953388

commit_message:
Undercloud: support for external VIP for SSL

Wires in the use of ../network/ports/external_from_pool.yaml
so that we can control the named 'public_virtual_ip' created in
overcloud.yaml when using Undercloud SSL.

By default this has previously gone to the ctlplane IP for the
Undercloud itself. When SSL is enabled we want it set to a different
VIP managed by Haproxy/keepalived. If SSL is disabled
python-tripleoclient just sets it to the ctlplane so the previous
behavior is preserved.

Change-Id: Id8127efc658f4bae3176d7394a32face6030303c

I think i'd prefer bounds=True, although it looks like when oslo.config generates the commented-out default value, it doesn't include the [ ] even when bounds=True."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-02-15 17:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

URI filtering for web-download

Implement URI filtering to prevent port scanning with the web-download
Image import method.

Closes-Bug: #1748512

which was merged prematurely as grenade is still testing pike->master. With this patch in place, the conductor is unable to restart thus failing the upgrade.

This reverts commit 6b995c07edcc1a4db4e869009541e82ad4943d31
which was merged prematurely as grenade is still testing pike->master.

With the original patch in place, the conductor is unable to restart
thus failing the upgrade.

This is no longer required once https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543615
has merged.

Change-Id: I0fd0093ca256475fd87563cf948a05a1de4b60f8
Closes-Bug: #1749613
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Clean up RPC versions and database migrations for Rocky"

This reverts commit 6b995c07edcc1a4db4e869009541e82ad4943d31
which was merged prematurely as grenade is still testing pike->master.

With the original patch in place, the conductor is unable to restart
thus failing the upgrade.

This is no longer required once https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543615
has merged.

Change-Id: I0fd0093ca256475fd87563cf948a05a1de4b60f8
Closes-Bug: #1749613

[{'created': '2018-01-09 14:44:34.000000000', 'message': "Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in multi-line strings

blocktrans trimmed option removes newlines from contents of blocktrans
and replaces any whitespace at the beginning and end of a line into

Closes-Bug: #1742162

commit_message:
Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in multi-line strings

blocktrans trimmed option removes newlines from contents of blocktrans
and replaces any whitespace at the beginning and end of a line into
a single space. This makes translator life easier.

Change-Id: I50d5e4ea364a70a42e4309c919f4eb3c3a0ebc37
Closes-Bug: #1742162

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 22:34:08.000000000', 'message': "Generate proxy methods from resource objects

Each service has a set of Resources which define the fundamental
qualities of the remote resources. Because of this, a large portion
of the methods on Proxy classes are (or can be) boilerplate.

Add a metaclass (two in a row!) that reads the definition of the
Proxy class and looks for Resource classes attached to it. It then checks
them to see which operations are allowed by looking at the Resource's
allow_ flags. Based on that, it generates the standard methods and doc
strings from a template and adds them to the class.

If a method exists on the class when it is read, the generated method
does not overwrite the existing method. Instead, it is attached as
``_generated_{method_name}``. This allows people to either write
specific proxy methods and completely ignore the generated method,
or to write specialized methods that then delegate action to the generated
method.

Since this is done as a metaclass at class object creation time,
things like sphinx continue to work.

One of the results of this is the addition of a reference to each
resource class on the proxy object. I've wanted one of those before (I
don't remember right now why I wanted it)

This makes a change to just a few methods/resources in Server as an
example of impact. If we like it we can go through and remove all of the
boilerplate methods and leave only methods that are special.

openstack.compute.v2._proxy.Proxy.servers is left in place largely
because it has a special doc string. I think we could (and should)
update the generation to look at the query parameters to find and
document in the docstring for list methods what the supported parameters
are.

This stems from some thinking we had in shade about being able to
generate most of the methods that fit the pattern. It's likely we'll
want to do that for shade methods as well - but we should actually be
able to piggyback shade methods on top of the proxy methods, or at least
use a similar approach to reduce most of the boilerplate in the shade
layer.

Change-Id: I9bee095d90cad25acadbf311d4dd8af2e76ba00a

commit_message:
Generate proxy methods from resource objects

Each service has a set of Resources which define the fundamental
qualities of the remote resources. Because of this, a large portion
of the methods on Proxy classes are (or can be) boilerplate.

Add a metaclass (two in a row!) that reads the definition of the
Proxy class and looks for Resource classes attached to it. It then checks
them to see which operations are allowed by looking at the Resource's
allow_ flags. Based on that, it generates the standard methods and doc
strings from a template and adds them to the class.

If a method exists on the class when it is read, the generated method
does not overwrite the existing method. Instead, it is attached as
``_generated_{method_name}``. This allows people to either write
specific proxy methods and completely ignore the generated method,
or to write specialized methods that then delegate action to the generated
method.

Since this is done as a metaclass at class object creation time,
things like sphinx continue to work.

One of the results of this is the addition of a reference to each
resource class on the proxy object. I've wanted one of those before (I
don't remember right now why I wanted it)

This makes a change to just a few methods/resources in Server as an
example of impact. If we like it we can go through and remove all of the
boilerplate methods and leave only methods that are special.

openstack.compute.v2._proxy.Proxy.servers is left in place largely
because it has a special doc string. I think we could (and should)
update the generation to look at the query parameters to find and
document in the docstring for list methods what the supported parameters
are.

This stems from some thinking we had in shade about being able to
generate most of the methods that fit the pattern. It's likely we'll
want to do that for shade methods as well - but we should actually be
able to piggyback shade methods on top of the proxy methods, or at least
use a similar approach to reduce most of the boilerplate in the shade
layer.

Change-Id: I9bee095d90cad25acadbf311d4dd8af2e76ba00a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 17:37:55.000000000', 'message': 'Rename BaseProxy to Proxy

The base resource class is "Resource" but the base proxy class is
"BaseProxy" which makes reading the docs a bit strange. It was
originally not really a big real because nothing used Proxy directly.
But since we add Proxy instances to the Connection for every service in
service-types-authority which are now documented as part of the
Connection object, calling them BaseProxy is a bit weird.

Keep a BaseProxy object around so we don't break out of tree Proxy
objects, but add a deprecation to it so people can update.

Change-Id: I2778b2a04ad0aed4bb6b217151f41503997db1c6
'}, {'created': '2018-01-30 18:20:59.000000000', 'message': 'Rename BaseProxy to Proxy

The base resource class is "Resource" but the base proxy class is

commit_message:
Rename BaseProxy to Proxy

The base resource class is "Resource" but the base proxy class is
"BaseProxy" which makes reading the docs a bit strange. It was
originally not really a big real because nothing used Proxy directly.
But since we add Proxy instances to the Connection for every service in
service-types-authority which are now documented as part of the
Connection object, calling them BaseProxy is a bit weird.

Keep a BaseProxy object around so we don't break out of tree Proxy
objects, but add a deprecation to it so people can update.

Shift BaseProxy from the main user docs to the contributor layout docs.
Add showing inheritance, as well as docs for OpenStackSDKAdapter.

Change-Id: I2778b2a04ad0aed4bb6b217151f41503997db1c6

commit_message:
unreserve volumes after scheduling has failed

For creating instance with booting from a volume, the volume is reserved
before scheduling. When scheduling fails due to lack of valid hosts
, the instance goes to the ERROR state and the volume needs to be
unreserved otherwise it will be kept in the 'attaching' state.

Change-Id: Ib403bbb532b248084782d93f1a083d9d51069661
Closes-Bug: #1713641

[{'created': '2018-02-13 19:49:00.000000000', 'message': "Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin

In the past, we've messed around with enabling or disabling the

Change-Id: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46

commit_message:
Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin

In the past, we've messed around with enabling or disabling the
yum's fastestmirror plugin. It is helpful if you are running outside
the OpenStack CI system since it will find the fastest mirrors from
a publicly available mirror list.

However, in the CI system, we override the mirror list with a hard-
coded mirror in the `baseurl` line. There's no need to load or use
the fastestmirror plugin in these situations and gathering a list
of mirrors just slows things down.

This patch sets a fact that other roles can check and disable the
fastestmirror plugin when needed.

Change-Id: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46

Every CentOS host will need various yum utilities at some point, so
let's install it within openstack_hosts to save time later.

I would like to see us investigate some way to add a test to the ironic-tempest-plugin that plumbs through the usage of traits:

Then we'd know that this stuff is all working and won't regress it. Nova has a functional test using a fake virt driver to make sure that traits reported by the compute driver are put onto the resource provider in placement that represends the node, but we can't really do something like that in nova functional tests for ironic since we don't have a real ironic installation there (we could fake out the ironic API but that's not really something we want to do in functional tests)."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-02-12 20:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 18:41:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't JSON encode instance_info.traits for ironic

As of queens, the ironic virt driver pushes traits set on the flavor to
the ironic node's instance_info during instance spawn. This list of
traits is currently encoded as a JSON string, inside the JSON-encoded
instance_info. We should not use this double layer of JSON encoding, as
ironic expects instance_info.traits to be a list.

This change removes the nested JSON encoding when setting
node.instance_info.traits.

Change-Id: I1f3f96f7ef310022accde67cab1ae415bbc3c292
Closes-Bug: #1748942
"}]
commit_message:
Don't JSON encode instance_info.traits for ironic

As of queens, the ironic virt driver pushes traits set on the flavor to
the ironic node's instance_info during instance spawn. This list of
traits is currently encoded as a JSON string, inside the JSON-encoded
instance_info. We should not use this double layer of JSON encoding, as
ironic expects instance_info.traits to be a list.

This change removes the nested JSON encoding when setting
node.instance_info.traits.

Change-Id: I1f3f96f7ef310022accde67cab1ae415bbc3c292
Closes-Bug: #1748942

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I8f991d55b3fc089444c5b43dbd6c1a8957ffc864

In Python 3, dict methods dict.keys() return ‚Äúviews‚Äù instead of lists.
Therefore, the code:

    impls = sorted(matrix.targets.keys())

should be replaced by:

commit_message:
Python 3 fix for sphinx doc

In Python 3, dict methods dict.keys() return ‚Äúviews‚Äù instead of lists.
Therefore, the code:

    impls = sorted(matrix.targets.keys())
    impls.sort()

should be replaced by:

    impls = sorted(matrix.targets.keys())

to be Python 3 compatible.

Change-Id: I50477b0ac43adff9e9b0220bd7c48d6ebb6471b3

commit_message:
Force restart of ipsec in legacy setup

Force a restart of the ipsec daemon(s) after the configuration is
persisted. This should be safe as the tunnels run in kernel-space; and
should effectively reload all the configurations.

Change-Id: I914ba8e18cd071a1dce7ebca4afb21a341cf2406
Closes-Bug: #1749703

Change-Id: I48034d1433b7e67f1ce2853227dd5a539e15a360

commit_message:
Remove test_contains_current_release_entry

This test is not helpful for development at all - it only fails
after the version is issued, when it's too late to fix. Furthermore,
it blocks using the sem-ver tag in a commit message to bump minor or
major pre-version, as it expects the future release to exist.

Change-Id: I48034d1433b7e67f1ce2853227dd5a539e15a360

commit_message:
Inherit UpdateCommand class from overcloud DeployCommand class

Instead of dealing with some decidated functions in Update/upgrade
classes for manipulating the plan and the env files,
inherit the update class from the DeployCommand class will allow the
update && upgrade to take benefit from the plan management code
and all the tips and tricks that the deploy class does for handling
the corner cases of the plan (access rights, path of user files)
Also it avoid to rewrite/duplicate some code to solve the issue where
the --templates option is ignored by the update workflow
(and upgrade for Queens btw).
Related tripleo-common review:
https://review.openstack.org/540816

Depends-On: Ica4bb404cd3a38a97300b8af36af41c35f09825c
Change-Id: Ib96f4f5078ec1c45981d051e546bf931d2885ae2

commit_message:
Provide basic data for AArch64 support matrix/functionality

Nova has two pages in documentation listing things supported on several
architectures/hypervisors. This patch adds initial state of AArch64
into support matrix.

Document minimal qemu/libvirt for aarch64. Version 3.6.0 was first one
which worked for us with Nova without a need for extra patches.

Change-Id: I2ee7be9e88e20ed0f77be07fed4fdd800533b3c5

commit_message:
Install proposal scripts only when needed

Move proposal scripts from jenkins/scripts to the proposal directory
so that we can install them only for proposal scripts and do not need
to bake them into nodes.

Change-Id: I356906e4a43597cc913bfa539cac7c2c6dfce117

commit_message:
Consolidate common.sh script copying

Create new role for copying common scripts, this includes for now only
common.sh. Use this for proposal and translation jobs.

In the past we duplicated the file, this allows to have one definition
only.

Change-Id: I72c14341f511fdaa2c67a3758387afc9445869cc

commit_message:
Add way to customize the IPA version to be used

By using -e ipa_upstream_release=stable-mitaka, deployment
can now use all ramdisk and kernel images available in
https://tarballs.openstack.org/ironic-python-agent/tinyipa/files/
Furthermore, as some of these files do not have any .sha256
checksum associated to them, the downloading of these file
is now just issuing a "warning" and is not reported as an
Ansible error in the final summary.

Change-Id: Ib7624da0f7d5686f0f5cb6c6e98b48870364e91b

commit_message:
Align zaqar max_messages_post_size with undercloud

When deploying a containerized undercloud, we need the same
configuration as we used to have in instack-undercloud.

For max_messages_post_size, we used to have 1048576 due to the high size
of the messages with config-download.

Let's sync the config here, so we can deploy an overcloud with
config-download when a containerized undercloud is used.

Change-Id: Ib43c811d9ea4e71558c15c78cfb9999f738b8098

subject: Make the Image status transition early
messages: [{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:51:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 07:23:38.000000000', 'message': "Make the Image status transition early

When image-import call is made, all kind of things happens before
the image status transitions to 'importing'. We should do this as early
as possible to ensure that there is no user action against the image
while it's prcessed and the user gets the info that the importing is
actually happening.

Closes-Bug: #1749525

Change-Id: I3ff9f7af2f266dd60fd3ad738b1fb9eeb6fd9fb8
(cherry picked from commit 1f4a0cc4be204f8a584769a753893d2ab4a5d74b)
"}]
commit_message:
Make the Image status transition early

When image-import call is made, all kind of things happens before
the image status transitions to 'importing'. We should do this as early
as possible to ensure that there is no user action against the image
while it's prcessed and the user gets the info that the importing is
actually happening.

Closes-Bug: #1749525

Change-Id: I3ff9f7af2f266dd60fd3ad738b1fb9eeb6fd9fb8
(cherry picked from commit 1f4a0cc4be204f8a584769a753893d2ab4a5d74b)

subject: Fix requirements.txt for oslo.db (<4.19.0)
messages:
[{'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Copied from Bug-Comment: u-c for oslo.db is 4.17.1 which should work perfectly, issue seems to be because you must have oslo.db >= 4.19.0. Please check oslo.db version you have using: pip show oslo.db.
If wrong version is installed then that should be fixed. The proposed change should be avoided.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-02-15 11:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:45:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm abandoning this one because evidently this is broken in openstack-ansible (where I ran into this), not in Magnum. Apologies for the noise."}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 07:59:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect defaults initialization

set_defaults is invoked with 'magnum.sqlite' which is inappropriate;
the method expects a numerical value for max_pool_size here.

In master, this was fixed with change
I7ec8c94287e82fd51a1af66b864d9f52af5b63c5, but it was never
backported.

Change-Id: I2478f3c31bd8330152956216c6d1048bdd8bfe28
Closes-Bug: 1749654
"}, {'created': '2018-02-15 11:11:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix requirements.txt for oslo.db (<4.19.0)

The method signature for set_defaults() changed in oslo.db 4.19.0, so
if a later version of oslo.db is installed, the set_defaults()
invocation breaks.

Change-Id: I2478f3c31bd8330152956216c6d1048bdd8bfe28
Closes-Bug: 1749654
'}]
commit_message:
Fix requirements.txt for oslo.db (<4.19.0)

The method signature for set_defaults() changed in oslo.db 4.19.0, so
if a later version of oslo.db is installed, the set_defaults()
invocation breaks.

Change-Id: I2478f3c31bd8330152956216c6d1048bdd8bfe28
Closes-Bug: 1749654

commit_message:
Release ironic-inspector 7.2.0 for Queens

An out-of-order release to fix three bugs, one of which is critical.
One of the fixes adds a dependency on python-retrying, hence
the minor version bump.

Change-Id: I0a4b0f990d71a72069976eb884ff57df2c277260

commit_message:
Add check to enable additional ansible tag for updates

This will make sure we only go through the update tasks in jobs which
need it.

Change-Id: Ia6b4daeeb1924af5de7598c4a42b5ccf1d13d1de

Ironic: move cleaning net managment to job

This PS moves the cleaning net managment to a job.

Additionally the gate scripts are updated to enable single node
operation for development use.

subject: Updated from OpenStack Service Type Authority
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-13 16:21:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Oh, yeah, this has to stop.  The bot triggered based on a change which *should* have been a no-op.

commit_message:
Sort json data

The patches from the proposal bot are large and unreadable because our
starting data is not sorted like the data that we're publishing now is.

Sort the current data by hand so that the proposal bot changes can
actually be read.

Change-Id: I6066d7f74b7abee87a63115941bdced1d44e39b7

Thanks for the urgency on this!'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:44:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Will this not break any scenarios deploying telemetry?  Or are we not testing telemetry sufficiently to notice that it can't actually talk to snmp on the overcloud?"}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

we probably just wont get hardware metrics. I doubt if we have any test coverage for those. Lets see how the scenarios turn out.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-02-14 20:24:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Fair enough, looks like it is working. commit_message:
Disable SNMP service in all CI jobs

Some work is being done in I46fce28926cb5a881f7384948480266712ae75e3
to secure SNMP on a specific network but until then we need to stop
opening the services so cloud providers won't report any security issue
for TripleO jobs.

Change-Id: Icd8a6ddda6152186d6be4a227f6449232fecba5e
Related-Bug: #1749324

commit_message:
Move aide db when needed

The task that moves the aide database checks to see whether aide
was just initialized, but that task has a "changed_when: false" to
help with idempotency. That means that the database never gets
moved into place.

This patch changes the task to check whether the aide
initialization was skipped or not. If it wasn't skipped, then the
database will be moved.

Closes-Bug: 1745675
Change-Id: I2f186274cbff4b38706603a51429557057843e4e
(cherry picked from commit 295ef13395a2edf1922b0d5a31f224fdf4b0b525)

commit_message:
tasks: Replace deprecated 'include' statements

Ansible 2.4+ complains that 'include' statements are deprecated in
favor of 'import_tasks' and 'include_tasks' so replace all of them.

Change-Id: Ib65187c1239482bfd823b2f3dfd437aa7a709ccd

subject: tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Workaround Ansible 2.4+ precedence bug
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 13:09:30.000000000', 'message': "tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Workaround Ansible 2.4+ precedence bug

Ansible 2.4+ suffers from a precedence bug when including tasks in
roles. It appears that a file in a relative tasks/ path inside the
current working directory is preferred over an identical file
from the role itself. For example:

task path: /home/zuul/.ansible/roles/previous_galera_server/tasks/galera_install.yml:20
included: /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/tasks/galera_install_apt.yml for container1

As one can see, instead of including the galera_install_apt.yml from the
/home/zuul/.ansible/roles/previous_galera_server/tasks/ directory, the
one which is relative to the current working directory
(/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/)
is preferred. We can simply workaround that by entering a different
directory which doesn't look like a role directory structure before executing
that part of the upgrade job.

Change-Id: If208e72d66ed441e8fcdee4882637301527cb231
Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/34790
"}]
commit_message:
tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Workaround Ansible 2.4+ precedence bug

Ansible 2.4+ suffers from a precedence bug when including tasks in
roles. It appears that a file in a relative tasks/ path inside the
current working directory is preferred over an identical file
from the role itself. For example:

task path: /home/zuul/.ansible/roles/previous_galera_server/tasks/galera_install.yml:20
included: /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/tasks/galera_install_apt.yml for container1

As one can see, instead of including the galera_install_apt.yml from the
/home/zuul/.ansible/roles/previous_galera_server/tasks/ directory, the
one which is relative to the current working directory
(/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/)
is preferred. We can simply workaround that by entering a different
directory which doesn't look like a role directory structure before executing
that part of the upgrade job.

Change-Id: If208e72d66ed441e8fcdee4882637301527cb231
Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/34790

commit_message:
Move aide db when needed

The task that moves the aide database checks to see whether aide
was just initialized, but that task has a "changed_when: false" to
help with idempotency. That means that the database never gets
moved into place.

This patch changes the task to check whether the aide
initialization was skipped or not. If it wasn't skipped, then the
database will be moved.

Closes-Bug: 1745675
Change-Id: I2f186274cbff4b38706603a51429557057843e4e
(cherry picked from commit 295ef13395a2edf1922b0d5a31f224fdf4b0b525)

commit_message:
Remove the non-voting option of openstack-python35-jobs for blazar repos

Blazar repos have started to support Python3. This patch removes
the non-voting option of openstack-python35-jobs.

Change-Id: Ide211285b101e2d28e182ee415a4b8d26015710c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-21 09:21:41.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to disable DNS server announcement per subnet

Currently there is no way to have dhcp agents not announce DNS servers
for a subnet. The current behaviour when the dns_nameservers option is
set to '0.0.0.0' is that each agent will only announce itself instead of
announcing the list of all dhcp agents for that subnet, which seems not
too useful. So we redefine the meaning of this option to instruct the
dhcp agent to not announce any DNS server in that case.

Actually, going back to square one, it would be more natural to swap the
meaning of "option unset" and "option 0.0.0.0", but that would change
the default behaviour for all existing installation and thus does not
seem feasible.

Change-Id: I32d943360162c483ac1364100a21ab56b13517fb
Closes-Bug: 1311040

commit_message:
Allow to disable DNS server announcement per subnet

Currently there is no way to have DHCP agents not announce DNS servers
for a subnet. The current behaviour when the dns_nameservers option is
set to '0.0.0.0' is that each agent will only announce itself instead of
announcing the list of all dhcp agents for that subnet, which seems not
too useful. So we redefine the meaning of this option to instruct the
DHCP agent to not announce any DNS server in that case.

Actually, going back to square one, it would be more natural to swap the
meaning of "option unset" and "option 0.0.0.0", but that would change
the default behaviour for all existing installation and thus does not
seem feasible.

Change-Id: I32d943360162c483ac1364100a21ab56b13517fb
Closes-Bug: 1311040

commit_message:
Add platform build jobs to nodepool experimental

We don't need to run all these on every change, but having them in the
experimental queue means we can test them without having to make [dnm]
changes in glean/dib

Change-Id: Ia859d6e54a502834be66d36232e33632fe91c287

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 11:50:37.000000000', 'message': 'Keep a default value for NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR.

Without this the deployment fail when used outside of openstack ci as
the nodepool definition may not have the complete set of variable
defined.

This error happen:

+(/home/centos/tripleo-root/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh:377): echo_vars_to_deploy_env_oofor VAR in NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR http_proxy MY_IP no_proxy NODECOUNT SSH_OPTIONS STABLE_RELEASE TRIPLEO_ROOT TOCI_JOBTYPE JOB_NAME SUBNODES_SSH_KEY FEATURE_BRANCH BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES_MINIMAL
/home/centos/tripleo-root/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh: line 378: !VAR: unbound variable

when using traas[1] tool.

[1] https://github.com/slagle/traas

Change-Id: I70ad40580230307257fd0ea60961a204074927f3
'}]
commit_message:
Keep a default value for NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR.

Without this the deployment fail when used outside of openstack ci as
the nodepool definition may not have the complete set of variable
defined.

This error happen:

+(/home/centos/tripleo-root/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh:377): echo_vars_to_deploy_env_oofor VAR in NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR http_proxy MY_IP no_proxy NODECOUNT SSH_OPTIONS STABLE_RELEASE TRIPLEO_ROOT TOCI_JOBTYPE JOB_NAME SUBNODES_SSH_KEY FEATURE_BRANCH BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES_MINIMAL
/home/centos/tripleo-root/tripleo-ci/scripts/common_functions.sh: line 378: !VAR: unbound variable

when using traas[1] tool.

[1] https://github.com/slagle/traas

Change-Id: I70ad40580230307257fd0ea60961a204074927f3

commit_message:
Monasca Ceilometer spec

Package Ceilometer with Monasca Ceilometer storage
driver and publisher. Monasca Ceilometer publishes
and stores all ceilometer data in monasca datastore.

Notable changes for backport: added -api and -collector
subpackages (Pike is the last release where Ceilometer comes
with these components)

Depends-on: I8de2150cd527491db100703dac165ce950f205bf
Change-Id: I8ae715bc916635edd02bd14668f13b5cdf535443
(cherry picked from commit b0a0f0d6649f2b59c9d360b5e6cc308b86da4707)

subject: Use bool instead of int for boolean filter value
messages: [{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-15 02:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 22:19:38.000000000', 'message': "Use bool instead of int for boolean filter value

At this layer, it's a boolean filter; we should let the ORM
make the translation for whatever backend is in use.  MySQL
didn't care, but PostgreSQL is a bit more picky.

Co-authored-by: Scott McClymont <scott.mcclymont@verizonwireless.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id1e5d2cec3be48f6a5164582591f2fd2f565a96b
Closes-bug: #1749297
(cherry picked from commit bac4595e08c23859345e8c80af8db5dd36c269b9)
"}]
commit_message:
Use bool instead of int for boolean filter value

At this layer, it's a boolean filter; we should let the ORM
make the translation for whatever backend is in use.  MySQL
didn't care, but PostgreSQL is a bit more picky.

Co-authored-by: Scott McClymont <scott.mcclymont@verizonwireless.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id1e5d2cec3be48f6a5164582591f2fd2f565a96b
Closes-bug: #1749297
(cherry picked from commit bac4595e08c23859345e8c80af8db5dd36c269b9)

commit_message:
Cleanup basic import tasks

Fix inconsistency in the way parameters were being passed
around the tasks.  It was preventing them from working
reliably.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1749461
Change-Id: I05b5fe8d99cc0f8edd89c707fd030f5bf762fe06
(cherry picked from commit 0b22c77ab346360496e5208d4f474db807293909)

commit_message:
Change type of CephAnsiblePlaybook from string to comma_delimited_list

Enables users to run more than one CephAnsiblePlaybook during deployment
if desired. Change is backwards compatible in case string is passed.

Depends-On: I70786ab7b81f9985ddf1148b14ef803c327752b9
Change-Id: Ie0e6e53ed08a22b1453ab1230c7c6d46104716fa

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 jobs (almost all of them)

It defines buildimages/CLI jobs, and reuses the global pylint job
and few jobs from sahara-tests (scenario, tempest), mimicking
the existing definitions of the legacy jobs.

Still missing: grenade (there is no common grenade job yet at this
point).

Change-Id: Ibb57e216410afeef4d55d8ba2576aaacfa2f8c1a
(cherry picked from commit 6fc0f25c62e4ea8e19a3f44c2dce6f89cf742645)

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Add async replication support

Currently, only Synchronous mode is supported for volume replication
on VMAX. This patch adds Asynchronous remote replication support.

Change-Id: If5df30b6ac8544f4c98b4dec89ad3b032b80d379
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmax-replication-enhancements

[{'created': '2018-02-14 19:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'Adding Ambari 2.4.2.0 to image gen

We missed ambari 2.4.2.0 on ambari image gen

Also we are disabling CA checking for Centos/RHEL because the default SSL
certificate, which is generated when the Ambari server is installed, is
invalid.

Partial-bug: #1748507
Change-Id: I272dbab4458c902af404a6365a8a43d56e4ed94e
(cherry picked from commit e97e0abb2b15da0e0f7400c26ad75cb10afe319b)
'}]
commit_message:
Adding Ambari 2.4.2.0 to image gen

We missed ambari 2.4.2.0 on ambari image gen

Also we are disabling CA checking for Centos/RHEL because the default SSL
certificate, which is generated when the Ambari server is installed, is
invalid.

Partial-bug: #1748507
Change-Id: I272dbab4458c902af404a6365a8a43d56e4ed94e
(cherry picked from commit e97e0abb2b15da0e0f7400c26ad75cb10afe319b)

commit_message:
Fix the parameter in api-ref

Here, the mapping of parameter 'image_id' is wrong since it is used in path.
So, fix it.

Change-Id: I582f4bbd39407c27c0875db11d8f70f82bc2576e
(cherry picked from commit 6861df5289cecc919f903b731930280e0ce898b6)

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 jobs

Use the jobs defined by sahara-tests, and force the installation of
the saharaclient code by tuning LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/512058
Change-Id: I33641a575b0529d6ff53ca9cf2b14e7d67d53084
(cherry picked from commit 8539116be54f4dbde94bba1b0cc5f2802a09591b)

commit_message:
[envs] Implmenet Env CLI commands

- Introduce Env CLI commands & bash completition
- Use RALLY_ENV variable in both cases for deployments and env
- Smooth RALLY_DEPLOYMENT -> RALLY_ENV migration
- Implement unit tests
- Implement functional tests

Change-Id: I56a60bd35bdc5ff833fdcad19f13ecf55496a316

commit_message:
Avoid hard-coded settings in Cinder HA containers

Add parameters for controlling the docker container settings used to
create the cinder-volume and cinder-backup pacemaker bundles. The
parameters eliminate the need to hard-code the list of docker volumes
and environment variables, making it possible to control the values
using hiera data.

For backward compatibility, the previous hard-coded values are used
when no parameter inputs are supplied.

Partial-Bug: #1748290
Change-Id: I4ba0d78ad17183b97290b853a6c103e55bc8977c

commit_message:
undercloud_post: fix subnet name

The default control plane subnet name is "ctlplane-subnet", so let's
create the right subnet for the containerized undercloud.

Note: the subnet can't be overriden (yet) but for now we rely on the
default.

Change-Id: I15954bced81ef6c3e1a1f4a73bc989f33d08d6f7

commit_message:
Allow udev events to complete

It is possible that the udev events will be triggered, the hook
execution finished, another hook fires, and a second attempt to
mount the devices happens despite a check if a device is mounted.
By allowing udev events to settle, any mounts desired should be
attempted before completing hook execution.

Change-Id: Iaf8f0edf31084894fdd73fab99f750905476c4cf
Partial-Bug: #1746118

commit_message:
Adds documentation (part 2)

This patch adds additional documentation regarding various
features introduced in the Hyper-V Driver, how to configure
the compute node in order to use them, and how to use them:

* Generation 2 VMs
* UEFI Secure Boot
* Shielded VMs
* Setting boot order
* RemoteFX
* Hyper-V vNUMA
* QoS
* PCI devices
* Serial ports
* Nested Virtualization

Additionally, this patch adds more details on how to add the
compute nodes to Nova cells.

commit_message:
[testing] Refactor CLI tests and utils

* Make hook tests pass on any platform
* Fix Task Import tests (not sure why they worked before)
* Reduce the time required to run tests
* Use getjson where suitable
* Use no_logs where logs may cause problems

commit_message:
vars: Install qpress only when galera_xtrabackup_compression is true

The qpress library is only needed for xtrabackup compression. The
compression only occurs when a new node is joining the cluster
which shouldn't happen very often. The variable is set to true only
when the architecture is x86_64 since that's the only arch that's
supported by the upstream repository and CentOS and Ubuntu do not
provide qpress in the downstream distributions at all.

Change-Id: Iae8b5d0e0998c85ee453efc6620940c80243540e

commit_message:
Run openrc role ahead of rolling test script

The rolling upgrade test script requires a clouds.yaml file to look up
the required authentication information. Run the openstack_openrc role
to create clouds.yaml.

commit_message:
keystone: disable config generator test

This commit disables the config generator test for the Keystone
package. The test will only work in a tox generated venv but
fail when tests are run by ostestr: It runs oslo-config-generator
in a shell. This in turn requires python-keystone be available
for oslo-config-generator to use at a time when we haven't
even built, let alone installed, a python-keystone package
yet.

Cherry pick also includes:
If5100981aacb3004583aca0d2d61ff3306ff1dad
AKA 4c26946c7eb1a47e32ddbba5a3a91ab1230874a5

(cherry picked from commit 339280106132f0af457af850fa3eee4bff4a796d)
Change-Id: I8de2150cd527491db100703dac165ce950f205bf

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I66668c220d41e035ff40cd233f36a1bb0ba97b52

subject: Disables CA checking for Ambari on Centos/RHEL
messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-14 19:57:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-15 12:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 19:57:03.000000000', 'message': 'Disables CA checking for Ambari on Centos/RHEL

The default SSL certificate, which is generated when the Ambari server is
installed, is invalid.

We are disabling check for now.

Change-Id: Ifcbc931e2ca23cb1fe221d509f57750e7e060aea
Partial-bug: #1748507
(cherry picked from commit 6229ee0de96f7e6846815335bc198c1f24897d95)
'}]
commit_message:
Disables CA checking for Ambari on Centos/RHEL

The default SSL certificate, which is generated when the Ambari server is
installed, is invalid.

We are disabling check for now.

Change-Id: Ifcbc931e2ca23cb1fe221d509f57750e7e060aea
Partial-bug: #1748507
(cherry picked from commit 6229ee0de96f7e6846815335bc198c1f24897d95)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I39478b0640e0bbb463b83a507df8dc681eaa72c5

commit_message:
Fix memcached_server linting issues

This patch fixes two PEP8 issues and skips ansible-lint checks
on two command tasks that don't create files.

Change-Id: I7fdface75d061051bd1c14d7229013fa79f7d84b

This change updates the preseed files and the default
openstack-user-config file so that deployers can use and test nspawn
type containers using the in-built automation.

commit_message:
Update mnaio to allow deployers to use nspawn

This change updates the preseed files and the default
openstack-user-config file so that deployers can use and test nspawn
type containers using the in-built automation.

Change-Id: I2ec3bd284540fa9f79490a350f016ca594fb5f98
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

doc: Clarify how to create your own filter

The filter-scheduler doc was pretty old and I was recently asked to give
some guidance on how to create a custom filter.
A doc is better than any chat, so let's make that better.

Change-Id: I64d24fb4337bb8c1e59a04818307b43f181e2ad2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 10:43:44.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for Bifrost being unable to write to /etc/hosts

Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within a container, so add a
host entry during bootstrap.

Change-Id: Ied378b4dd755788e75ad1814cecb5700732ba83e
Closes-Bug: #1661009
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for Bifrost being unable to write to /etc/hosts

Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within a container, so add a
host entry during bootstrap.

Change-Id: Ied378b4dd755788e75ad1814cecb5700732ba83e
Closes-Bug: #1661009

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ief04cbef169f7f2681b45a6a645612d60b3a20c4

These calls are subject to transient network problems, we should
not abort ironic-inspector process in this case. Also due to
bug 1748893 the port listing API can sometimes return HTTP 400.

before aborting the periodic task and thus the process.

commit_message:
Retry port lists on failure in PXE filter periodic sync

These calls are subject to transient network problems, we should
not abort ironic-inspector process in this case. Also due to
bug 1748893 the port listing API can sometimes return HTTP 400.

This change retries port listing 5 times with 1 second break
before aborting the periodic task and thus the process.

This change introduces a dependency on the retrying library,
which is already widely used in OpenStack (including ironic).

Change-Id: I92fd70ca5692ce9f6798eedf9e540d5aa7c6f1af
Closes-Bug: #1748893
(cherry picked from commit 3237511cc630c0f1da4cb89a71ab2d945080bc7c)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Fix image namespace test logging

This commit fixes the BaseV2ImageTest create_namespace instance
function to use self instead of cls, so that find_test_caller
can look up the object's fields while inspecting the call frame.

Change-Id: Iabfdcb90a8d37c7bcdefdb2f99d60bf034e24fd9
Closes-Bug: 1748064

And it's not failing in pike, ocata or newton so I guess this is a regression somewhere in queens."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Copied from test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name
this is a similar test which creates a server with a multi-byte
unicode name.

in the queens release, and to make sure we don't regress again in
the future.

commit_message:
Add simple compute API test to create server with utf8 name

Copied from test_create_image_specify_multibyte_character_image_name
this is a similar test which creates a server with a multi-byte
unicode name.

This is needed to verify what appears to be a regression in nova
in the queens release, and to make sure we don't regress again in
the future.

Depends-On: I7afce618deca3baaa96605a6b48c1c2ef4a5f2a5

Change-Id: If5a76dc3b03e5f7ceb4c03b3555318170e2ce69f
Related-Bug: #1730756

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin Andr√©', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:32:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this is WIP and only adds a failing test, implementation (fix) to follow'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 09:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

this a little change looks REALLY a CI disruptor :('}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

We really only want the containerized services in here. I think there is a bit of confusion on how the container image prepare command works, see my comment on bug #1749468.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That was my 1st thought as well, Mandre. Then my 2nd thought was of upgrades paths for legacy services:

- a user installed a service with Pike or Ocata, on the host under systemd control plane.
- now he upgrades to Queens and wants to have that service containerized
- AFAIK, in order to run an upgrade command, the user has to preserve all of the '-e' files he initially deployed with.

So the question is: shall we allow to refer the services from /puppet/services (this patch) or require them changed to /docker/services (a docs change TBD)? The things are getting complicated for the references like /environments/cinder-backup.yaml. Now the user has to go and change all of the references, from puppet to docker, for all of the services included in /environments/cinder-backup.yaml et al."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

According to the discussion with Martin, this should be a documentation issue and we can not change the tripleo client to work the proposed way, which is automatically detect container images for services referenced **not** from /docker/services paths.'}]

commit_message:
Autoeval container images for legacy services

When container prep images invoked for non dockerish env files,
like '-e mytht/environments/services/legacy.yaml', which refers
to some 'puppet/legacy.yaml' deployed on the host,
it omits that service and does not generate parameters
for the containerized service image.

That poses an issue as users might want those parameters generated
for upgrading that 'puppet/legacy.yaml' into its containerized
'docker/supermicroservice.yaml' version.

Closes-Bug: #1749468
Change-Id: Idad76778bf81b5882150716236cb11cce94aca78
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 18:34:08.000000000', 'message': "Start nova-conductor container first

On stable/newton, if you reboot an AIO the nova-conductor and
nova-api-metadata services start at the same time, and it appears that
nova-conductor needs to be up first before nova-api-metadata starts.
When this isn't the case, the nova-api-metadata service eventually
times out (cleanly), and requires a manual start/restart to bring it
online.

This commit simply gives the nova-conductor containers a start order of
39, and the remaining nova containers a start order of 49. This ensures
that nova-conductor starts before nova-api-metadata comes up.

Change-Id: I5fe06ee86070c8e30fa3e169a128e95b660df4df
"}]
commit_message:
Start nova-conductor container first

On stable/newton, if you reboot an AIO the nova-conductor and
nova-api-metadata services start at the same time, and it appears that
nova-conductor needs to be up first before nova-api-metadata starts.
When this isn't the case, the nova-api-metadata service eventually
times out (cleanly), and requires a manual start/restart to bring it
online.

This commit simply gives the nova-conductor containers a start order of
39, and the remaining nova containers a start order of 49. This ensures
that nova-conductor starts before nova-api-metadata comes up.

Change-Id: I5fe06ee86070c8e30fa3e169a128e95b660df4df

commit_message:
os-faults: add missing version constraint

These are not in global-requirements.txt.
Use py2pkg for ansible, as it is a pypi package.
The click package in RDO is too old, so leave that out for now.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/544053

We need to investigate the test failures.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2017-12-21 13:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2017-12-26 09:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Seems good to me. To other cores: please review this patch very thoroughly! The change is very useful but if it has concurrent/cleanup issues then it may create serious problems for us.'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-01-19 17:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks for the patch. I have only vague ideas of how caching is done in Keystone, but if I understood the messages right, they actually removed in-process type of caching in favor of memcached. Is it a good idea that we want to introduce it? Also, it would be good to see a benchmark that shows how much this can improve the performance in general cases and special ones, too.
The code seems fine, I just would like to see some numbers too.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-01-23 05:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Mike, would you be able to provide some numbers? At least rough. How it works without this caching and with it.

Generally, in-process caching is much faster, usually at least an order of magnitude. It's basically RAM vs inter-process access.


As far as data consistency, Mike, I just realized that there's a problem with it in our approach. We've taken care of the case when we upload a new action definition (for ad-hoc actions whose definitions are in YAML, others are considered immutable), we simply clean up the cache. But we didn't take into account that uploading a new action definition may happen on a different node, so caches on other nodes will become stale. I now see the following possible solutions:

* Do something like I did in https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/mistral/lang/parser.py#L218 (read the docstring), it prevents from reading a stale value from the cache.
* Exclude ad-hoc actions from caching at all. By the way, I would expect that they are used pretty rarely comparing to regular Python actions.


What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-02-12 15:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:40:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Awesome, now I'm fully satisfied with the solution. I think practically this delay in 60 seconds to update action definitions in the cache is a good trade-off. It fits to the concept of eventual consistency for distributed systems."}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-02-15 08:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Cache action definitions

Now to perform some action mistral gets its definition from
the database first. It's not really optimal, because if there are
a lot of similar action calls, mistral will reread the same data
from db. It increases the whole execution time and the load on the
database.

To improve the performance it's suggested to cache read definitions
and take them from the cache instead of the database in the subsequent
times.

Cache ttl can be configured with ``action_definition_cache_time``
option from [engine] group. The default value is 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I330b7cde982821d4f0a06cdd2954499ac0b7be37
