commit_message:
ignore compute.instance.update for metrics

nova sends *.update events in between create.start and create.end
events and it might not have a host name (which we need). in reality
to any changes to vcpus/memory/root_gb/ephemeral_gb metrics will
either send a *.resize notification and/or require a reboot which
sends it's own notification. because of that, just ignore
*.update notifications

Change-Id: I1f975c2d73adfc19126d70bdb1ab452e37b278fd
closes-bug: #1718290
(cherry picked from commit 192620941c01f3f4f1205be457e5efdfe321c0b0)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Iab8c46c9c4d8df9f3817d37550779ce965ad8633

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 13:27:02.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Retry port lists on failure in PXE filter periodic sync

These calls are subject to transient network problems, we should
not crash ironic-inspector process in this case. Also due to
bug 1748893 the port listing API can sometimes return HTTP 400.

This change retries port listing 3 times with 1 second break
before aborting the periodic task and thus the process.

We're not using the retrying library as it will probably make
the change not backportable.

Change-Id: I92fd70ca5692ce9f6798eedf9e540d5aa7c6f1af
Closes-Bug: #1748893
"}, {'created': '2018-02-13 16:11:03.000000000', 'message': 'Retry port lists on failure in PXE filter periodic sync

These calls are subject to transient network problems, we should
not crash ironic-inspector process in this case. Also due to
bug 1748893 the port listing API can sometimes return HTTP 400.

This change retries port listing 3 times with 1 second break
before aborting the periodic task and thus the process.

This change introduces a dependency on the retrying library,
which is already widely used in OpenStack (including ironic).

Change-Id: I92fd70ca5692ce9f6798eedf9e540d5aa7c6f1af
Closes-Bug: #1748893
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 14:11:28.000000000', 'message': 'Retry port lists on failure in PXE filter periodic sync

not abort ironic-inspector process in this case. Also due to
bug 1748893 the port listing API can sometimes return HTTP 400.

This change retries port listing 5 times with 1 second break
before aborting the periodic task and thus the process.

This change introduces a dependency on the retrying library,

Change-Id: I92fd70ca5692ce9f6798eedf9e540d5aa7c6f1af
Closes-Bug: #1748893
'}]
commit_message:
Retry port lists on failure in PXE filter periodic sync

These calls are subject to transient network problems, we should
not abort ironic-inspector process in this case. Also due to
bug 1748893 the port listing API can sometimes return HTTP 400.

This change retries port listing 5 times with 1 second break
before aborting the periodic task and thus the process.

This change introduces a dependency on the retrying library,
which is already widely used in OpenStack (including ironic).

Change-Id: I92fd70ca5692ce9f6798eedf9e540d5aa7c6f1af
Closes-Bug: #1748893

commit_message:
Update requirements of Pike

This patch set restricts Watcher to use networkx <2.0
since there are some issues with >=2.0 version[1].

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-watcher/%23openstack-watcher.2018-02-13.log.html#t2018-02-13T12:38:44

Change-Id: I8d979c6db5ba693ec5c4b34209223031113924a6

commit_message:
Fix for proper usage when keystone enabled

Using export BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic one
can now use the dynamic inventory when keystone is enabled

Change-Id: I7a89169d421b83c76c67b748473751b7ba0ed1ad
Depends-On: Ie73781d5e284908468a0f9ccff544f4c9c845fdd

commit_message:
l3: don't begin db transaction in set_extra_attr_value

As ExtraAttributesMixin.set_extra_attr_value() is assumed to be called
by callback of PRECOMMIT. So there is no point to start nested
transaction. So don't start transaction and check if transaction is
already started.

Change-Id: I0e2707222b1f91199cf466c997c0e691679fd3a4
Partial-bug: #1745633

commit_message:
Fix DHCP informations according to network interface settings

When the dhcp default or specified settings do not match
network interface configuration, messages are printed out
and auto-correction is applied to have a working dnsmasq.conf
configuration file

Change-Id: Id4c323c0a4d5c6c467b96fd27a51df4fcce65328
Closes-Bug: #1748186

subject: Secure convert_unit() function
messages: [{'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7923, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 10:48:31.000000000', 'message': "Secure convert_unit() function

This secures the utils.convert_unit function. Following work has been done:

* Systematically cast 'factor' to str type.

* Set a default value to factor argument to stay consistent with
  the offset parameter.

* Pass factor and offset as ints everywhere to keep consistency across
  collectors.

Change-Id: Idd31490ff01d42530cb6b54eef042a0746d12632
"}, {'created': '2018-02-14 16:31:50.000000000', 'message': "Secure convert_unit() function

This secures the utils.convert_unit function. Following work has been done:

* Convert all parameters to decimal.Decimal and handle all parameters the
  same way ('offset' and 'value' could not be a fraction until now,
  and there was a TypeError when 'factor' was an int).

* Set a default value to factor argument to stay consistent with
  the offset parameter.

* Pass factor and offset as ints everywhere to keep consistency across
  collectors.

Change-Id: Idd31490ff01d42530cb6b54eef042a0746d12632
"}]
commit_message:
Secure convert_unit() function

This secures the utils.convert_unit function. Following work has been done:

* Convert all parameters to decimal.Decimal and handle all parameters the
  same way ('offset' and 'value' could not be a fraction until now,
  and there was a TypeError when 'factor' was an int).

* Set a default value to factor argument to stay consistent with
  the offset parameter.

* Pass factor and offset as ints everywhere to keep consistency across
  collectors.

Change-Id: Idd31490ff01d42530cb6b54eef042a0746d12632

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I9d78ff57ce5cd503022033dd958f66122590c416

commit_message:
Use OpenStack documentation standards / Nova hypervisor-list API

This patch updates documents for aligning with OpenStack documentation
standards which include using the openstackdocstheme.
This patch also replaces Nova host-list API calls with hypervisor-list
API calls because the former was superseded by the latter [1].

These changes are not related but squashed into one patch for passing
gate tests.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-novaclient/queens.html#id4

Change-Id: I1fe652c17983f2b4505be50d01a26678bf50ef29
Partial-Bug: #1721489
(cherry picked from commit 0c286007c31e8b2e83b6b18a5281eee2c30a57fc)

commit_message:
Add a new CI gate for Manila and CephFS

This CI gate would conduct scenario testing for Manila with CephFS as
backend and NFS as storage protocol. Besides, this would be a
non-voting job for now.

Change-Id: I45d8400a1db45601a84734c4f7fd4bd132b789a3
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>

Hello Sampath,

I think that we should add openstacksdk to requirements.txt of masakari-monitors at first.

As a result, py27 test was failed.[2]

May be also start to add the release note as well?'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2018-02-13 08:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Sorry, I take back a part of my above comment.

The upper constraint of openstack-sdk is already larger than 0.10.0.
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/upper-constraints.txt#L411
That version doesn't contain "http_status".

So I think that masakari should accept openstack-sdk >=0.9.19, <=0.11.0.'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So we need to rewind 'Patch Sets 5' to 'Patch Sets 1'."}, {'account_id': 12950, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:11:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Following link is Monty's change.

Monty's patch landed on Rocky (current master). AFA I  can see, stable/queens is still same.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/global-requirements.txt?h=stable/queens
Unless they have plan to backport it."}, {'account_id': 8716, 'date': '2018-02-15 00:37:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Zuul requirenent is failing because this cange is check aginst current master of requirements which is Rocky. Which is not correct and this should be check against stable/queens requirements. I will try to make a work around for that. please let me know I'm wrong."}, {'account_id': 12950, 'date': '2018-02-15 03:01:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Hi Sampath,

I have an idea.

In global-requirement, as you said, current master (Rocky) code specifies 'openstacksdk>=0.11.2'.
But we are now specifes 'openstacksdk>=0.9.19' in requirements.txt.
I think this line causes zuul requirements-check failure.

So once we delete 'openstacksdk>=0.9.19' line in 'Patch Set 5', and let the patch set to pass the zuul job. (In this time, the code supports both versions.)
After merged in current master, create stable/queens branch. And then we can remove http_status code from master (Rocky) branch."}, {'account_id': 8716, 'date': '2018-02-15 03:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8716, 'date': '2018-02-15 03:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Use status_code instead of http_status

In exceptions.HttpException has no attribute 'http_status'.
Use status_code instead of http_status.In future, 'http_status'
parameter will be removed. For UT, use response object instead of
http_status.

Change-Id: Id0e3ae5377ea713cf2394975c827605dbc860143
Signed-off-by: Sampath Priyankara <sam47priya@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixes eventlet monotonic clock issue

The eventlet clock must be patched with the monotonic clock
in order to avoid issues caused by drifs of system time.

This is done in nova/__init__.py, but if compute-hyperv is
installed after nova, compute-hyperv will overwrite that
file.

Closes-Bug: #1749088

Change-Id: I0d32406a65d1f4d57435766d41a0f1c1efba2782

When image-import call is made, all kind of things happens before
the image status transitions to 'importing'. We should do this as early
as possible to ensure that there is no user action against the image
while it's prcessed and the user gets the info that the importing is
actually happening.

Closes-Bug: #1749525

Change-Id: I3ff9f7af2f266dd60fd3ad738b1fb9eeb6fd9fb8
"}]
commit_message:
Make the Image status transition early

When image-import call is made, all kind of things happens before
the image status transitions to 'importing'. We should do this as early
as possible to ensure that there is no user action against the image
while it's prcessed and the user gets the info that the importing is
actually happening.

Closes-Bug: #1749525

Change-Id: I3ff9f7af2f266dd60fd3ad738b1fb9eeb6fd9fb8

Currently, _update_inventory_attempt takes responsibility for resetting the provider tree if a generation conflict happens.

Is the eventual plan to raise a PlacementConflict and catch that somewhere up the stack, so this kind of thing can be unified?

In any case, this change appears correct for what it claims to do.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:55:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Currently, _update_inventory_attempt takes responsibility for resetting the provider tree if a generation conflict happens.
> 
> Is the eventual plan to raise a PlacementConflict and catch that somewhere up the stack, so this kind of thing can be unified?

Yes, totally.  At the moment we're kinda all over the place wrt conflict detection, cache invalidation, retries, etc.  I got convinced it's not an urgent problem because of the big-hammer lock we're taking in the resource tracker, but it would be nice to do a thorough sweep in Rocky to consolidate/unify as you say."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-02-05 17:24:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Sure, I'm cool with this."}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-02-07 08:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 22:34:35.000000000', 'message': "Avoid inventory DELETE API (no conflict detection)

SchedulerReportClient._delete_inventory used the DELETE
/resource_providers/{u}/inventories API, which does not provide a way to
send the generation down (see bug 1746373), and is therefore subject to
concurrency errors.

This change set removes the _delete_inventory method and uses PUT
/resource_providers/{u}/inventories with an empty 'inventories' dict
instead, because that API *does* take the generation in the payload.

Doing this makes moot part of bug 1746075 by removing one of the code
paths that exploits undocumented knowledge of how placement uses the
generation counter.

Change-Id: Ia8131b32debd56b28315ef430ee4e8888b6f56e7
Closes-Bug: #1746374
Related-Bug: #1746373
Related-Bug: #1746075

commit_message:
Avoid inventory DELETE API (no conflict detection)

SchedulerReportClient._delete_inventory used the DELETE
/resource_providers/{u}/inventories API, which does not provide a way to
send the generation down (see bug 1746373), and is therefore subject to
concurrency errors.

This change set removes the _delete_inventory method and uses PUT
/resource_providers/{u}/inventories with an empty 'inventories' dict
instead, because that API *does* take the generation in the payload.

Doing this makes moot part of bug 1746075 by removing one of the code
paths that exploits undocumented knowledge of how placement uses the
generation counter.

Change-Id: Ia8131b32debd56b28315ef430ee4e8888b6f56e7
Closes-Bug: #1746374
Related-Bug: #1746373
Related-Bug: #1746075

commit_message:
probetests: Close our handle to subprocess' stdouts

Otherwise, you could start running out of file handles when running all
tests. Previously, I'd regularly exceed 1k fds and then all subsequent
tests would fail; now, it maxes out around 90.

Change-Id: Ib53f15b5d2be95c70cce8903ea0ef5c334479837

commit_message:
kill orphans during probe test setup

orphans processes sometimes cause probe test failures so
get rid of them before each test.

Change-Id: I4ba6748d30fbb28371f13aa95387c49bc8223402

subject: Improved usage of args in .functests
messages:
[{'account_id': 27832, 'date': '2018-02-14 01:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-14 01:03:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-02-14 19:54:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I get that having the default command line flags tacked onto the execution command with no way to override them is annoying - so let's fix that by letting the caller pass in the args they want

If someone is already calling the script with --extra-flag it seems like not too much trouble to say --serial --pretty --extra-flag if that's what they want ???

especially if it keeps the bash simpler?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-14 20:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}]

If we're calling the script with --no-pretty option, --pretty will not
be passed to ostestr.

be passed to ostestr.
Also redirected cd commands' output to /dev/null in .functests.

Change-Id: I6e7e391c7e1659b86ab12eae4362b565218917b2
"}]
commit_message:
Improved usage of args in .functests

If we're calling the script with any arguments, --pretty will not
be passed to ostestr.
Also redirected cd commands' output to /dev/null in .functests.

Change-Id: I6e7e391c7e1659b86ab12eae4362b565218917b2

commit_message:
Update hacking requirement

This patch set updates test-requirements.txt to use the latest versions
of hacking. There is no reason to cap the hacking version to 0.14, as
other OpenStack project such as ironic [0] has brought the minimum
hacking version to 1.0.0.

Closes-Bug: #174100

[0] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/commit/3700e7c6d516b0a967ab2bfa2314a22233af637f

Change-Id: I5254613678a096a5b8730cdb42af3545a63fe1a9
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Add docs for application credentials

Add documentation in the User section on managing, using, and rotating
application credentials.

Since application credential support didn't make it into
python-openstackclient in the Queens release, show examples using
python-keystoneclient.

Change-Id: I24bc51d2f3741771ba321fc05d49fd111aa76c15

commit_message:
Use OpenStack documentation standards / Nova hypervisor-list API

This patch updates documents for aligning with OpenStack documentation
standards which include using the openstackdocstheme.
This patch also replaces Nova host-list API calls with hypervisor-list
API calls because the former was superseded by the latter [1].

These changes are not related but squashed into one patch for passing
gate tests.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-novaclient/queens.html#id4

Change-Id: I1fe652c17983f2b4505be50d01a26678bf50ef29
Partial-Bug: #1721489

[{'created': '2018-02-08 13:21:36.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I71cb6143ec78f0a12cfc818071efcda84637c25a
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I71cb6143ec78f0a12cfc818071efcda84637c25a

[{'created': '2018-02-07 11:21:11.000000000', 'message': "Enable to refresh ngdetails view

For now, refreshing ngdetails view by browser using F5 key or reload
button, it causes 404 error from django. To fix this issue, this patch
adds the url for '/ngdetails' into django.

To reproduce navigations, each request for views.py requires
'dashboard' and 'panel' object. Otherwise django side returns
500 error.

However the URL for request of details page (i.e. /ngdetails/)
can not provide informations to set the proper navigation.

So this patch set them to default dashboard and default panel.

This patch focuses to prevent 500 error. So the issue for
settings of proper navigation will be fixed by subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ib9f1fe48b3cdecff5ad56e68a5ba58a41cb35f38
Closes-Bug: #1681627
(cherry picked from commit 077163a03c9aea08efd56251e49d69eb1cc4d093)
"}]
commit_message:
Enable to refresh ngdetails view

For now, refreshing ngdetails view by browser using F5 key or reload
button, it causes 404 error from django. To fix this issue, this patch
adds the url for '/ngdetails' into django.

To reproduce navigations, each request for views.py requires
'dashboard' and 'panel' object. Otherwise django side returns
500 error.

However the URL for request of details page (i.e. /ngdetails/)
can not provide informations to set the proper navigation.

So this patch set them to default dashboard and default panel.

This patch focuses to prevent 500 error. So the issue for
settings of proper navigation will be fixed by subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ib9f1fe48b3cdecff5ad56e68a5ba58a41cb35f38
Closes-Bug: #1681627
(cherry picked from commit 077163a03c9aea08efd56251e49d69eb1cc4d093)

Thanks. I prefer to proceed with this revert if we cannot figure it out at a short time. I might become available to look into the kuryr-libnetwork fix but this won't happen soon."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:27:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.extensions%20import%20tag&i=nope&files=&repos="}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:34:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If necessary I'm OK with a revert, but I'd rather just take the short time to fix the issue if possible.. I can even look into if needed."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1 Code-Review-1

Based on in channel conversation, putting this on hold based on irc conversation: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/%23openstack-neutron.2018-02-14.log.html#t2018-02-14T16:36:26'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-02-14 19:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do I read it right that the fix will be to check for the new extension? and fall back to the old one if the new one is not present?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:29:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We are trying to address the issue with [1]. However [1] is becoming sufficiently large to perhaps warrant moving forward with this revert to give the team time to consume this change.


Unfortunately openstack/kuryr-libnetwork didn't use any of the tag/tag-ext extensions attributes and thus didn't import it. That's why it was missed on my radar when moving FW with the offending change. Upon consuming this chagne in openstack/kuryr-libnetwork I hope that they can use the extension (or API defs) attributes (e.g. ALIAS), not only to remove use the static string used today, but also to properly declare their intent of using the extension.


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544548/"}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Let's give time the kuryr team time to assimilate the change. In the meantime, let's revert"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:04:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I agree, let's fix Zun gate now :)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 06:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "remove tag and tag_ext extensions"

It looks this patch breaks Zun's gate. The reason might be
that Zun depends on Kuryr-libnetwork which still use the
legacy tag extension. I propose to revert this for now and
give the kuryr team some time to migrate to the new extension.

This reverts commit 38148d17528d2cb95972ba3da9e78fe0eed5e280.

Change-Id: If16443616eee703b66d57b6422dd451a443fbc64
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "remove tag and tag_ext extensions"

It looks this patch breaks Zun's gate. The reason might be
that Zun depends on Kuryr-libnetwork which still use the
legacy tag extension. I propose to revert this for now and
give the kuryr team some time to migrate to the new extension.

This reverts commit 38148d17528d2cb95972ba3da9e78fe0eed5e280.

Change-Id: If16443616eee703b66d57b6422dd451a443fbc64

commit_message:
Revert "ffu: tripleo-packages repo management"

This reverts commit 7cf9a76b7613fb028abcddf4a5d99f80d692cc0c.

The output of deploy-steps.j2 doesn't render correctly in the
config-download workflow. This ends up breaking IPSec which highly
relies on it.

Change-Id: I3805fa55a9f2b221a75ee68cd7a3dd854d131d0a
Closes-Bug: #1749338

commit_message:
undercloud_config: setup VIPs, haproxy, etc

This patch selectively enables setting up the required VIPs and
layers in the haproxy and keepalived services (on baremetal for now).

We only want to enable HAproxy in the undercloud when using TLS.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Depends-On: Icca382db28e4ea57f3cbf24e9e794b428b824db5

Change-Id: I94ce24f349c64b77d10112888a48f61e33a0ee45

commit_message:
Undercloud: fix stackrc TLS URL detection

We want to configure a TLS url for the underclouds stackrc
when a user specified or generated TLS certificate is used.
This patch updates the existing check so that
the PublicSSLCertificateAutogenerated paremeter is also used
when deciding if the SSL URL should be enabled.

Change-Id: I7561b5de7749ca57f8ac8056b470228e1026eb31

commit_message:
Solving permission errors due to directory ownership on NFS

We do the same work as the GlusterfsBackupDriver, uses chgrp+chmod to set
proper permissions on the directories if needs be.

Change-Id: Ic57c122311039af159c0cfc083e6e9349702d1e4
Closes-Bug: #1715456

commit_message:
Do not run stage-output again in Tempest

stage-output is already invoked in the devstack job.
Rather than running the role again in Tempest post, extend the
list of files to be staged and extensions to be converted to txt.

Change-Id: I0844700f1c770809cba5a2e0e39737fd6827896f
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/540485/

commit_message:
3PAR: Update CHAP on host record when volume is migrated to new compute host

When the nova instances are migrated from one compute host to another,
during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

Closes-Bug: #1737181

Change-Id: I2d4b7530b2d249ca193f7d0e87d529c9eb2dc25d
(cherry picked from commit bfc8c849df043d7695c70a5e90e5b95e93ce0728)

messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-01 00:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-06 09:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-07 01:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-07 11:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

i have two concerns here:
1. Not having enough time to get a parity support for drivers in LBaaS repo.
2. Octavia has a proxy for LBaaS - but getting it up and running and production grade will be a challenge for distributions. I think that if there is fair warning and this is done at the begiining of a cycle them we can do it.
I would prefer beginning of Rocky to approve this if possible.
Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

garyk
Please note, this is deprecation and not the removal of support or code at this time.  This is the warning to folks that they should be working on the steps you mentioned below.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-07 23:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would prefer that this be done beginning of R. Lets see what the others say.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-07 23:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

garyk, neutron-lbaas is already deprecated. This is just a documentation update in the legacy repositories. It's been a year and a half since we said we were going to do it, the parts are in place now, the LBaaS team voted to announce the deprecation, the e-mails have been sent out announcing this, and the code has already merged (neutron-lbaas is not a neutron project) and will release with Queens. This is not a vote to deprecate neutron-lbaas, that was already done here: https://review.openstack.org/310805"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-08 01:14:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The statement from johnsom is correct. neutron-lbaas is a separate governance (octavia team) and this is not the place to discuss the deprecation itself. neutron-lbaas documentation is hosted in the neutron and neutron-lib just from user's convenience because neutron-lbaas is served as part of neutron API (neutron-server)."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-08 08:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Personally I agree with Michael and Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I am not going to block this. I just feel that we should do this from Rocky. I have raised my concerns. Are any of the distributions releasing with Ocatavia yet? That may be orthogonal to this discussion.'}, {'account_id': 27366, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-02-14 20:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-02-14 20:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Mark neutron-lbaas as deprecated

This patch marks neutron-lbaas as deprecated in the neutron documentation.

It also removes some legacy LBaaS v1 documentation and neutron-lbaas bug
handling links.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 08:27:50.000000000', 'message': "Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
(cherry picked from commit 62ee18b359cbb2e6a9469bdaac9057ef19de1bdf)
"}, {'created': '2018-02-12 13:23:41.000000000', 'message': "Delete SQL users before deleting domain

middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

commit_message:
Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
(cherry picked from commit 62ee18b359cbb2e6a9469bdaac9057ef19de1bdf)

commit_message:
Add TripleO jobs for mistral client

As it was done for Mistral itself, add TripleO scenario003 jobs
to mistral client repo for checking mistral client patches with
TripleO.


Depends-On: I304547b9ecabe4e387339c8561bbae8651cd9db6
Change-Id: I7c985485a9d2f8fb8893e7ab5a00615999994c23

now that we're in Rocky.

Trivialfix

commit_message:
Fix arguments to oslo_context.RequestContext()

These tests are generating deprecation warnings since
they are using 'user' and 'tenant', update to use 'user_id'
and 'project_id'.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I8a2b4b5acc020f175c463df1f049eda802ab8873

commit_message:
Fix nits in allocation candidate limit handling

In the review for I5f3d4f49c34fd3cd6b9d2e12b3c3c4cdcb409bec some
non-blocking issues were identified. They are fixed here:

* inconsistent indentation in configuration setting
* creation of a uuid tracking set in the wrong block

Change-Id: I848d60f9a5d66cae584279f99a50b9e871540baf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 13:44:54.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ice400163ad57ce6fd716f25ee575e8143a6264a5
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ice400163ad57ce6fd716f25ee575e8143a6264a5

In "vpnaas.inc",vpnservice_id-path is used by three APIs in path and
maps to "service_id", reference to the API "Show VPN service details".

commit_message:
Change some parameters in path to be required

In "vpnaas.inc",vpnservice_id-path is used by three APIs in path and
maps to "service_id", reference to the API "Show VPN service details".
Similarly, ipsecpolicy_id-path and connection_id-path are also used
by vpn APIs in path.These three parameters should be required,so change
their attribute "required" in parameters.yaml from "false" to "true".

Change-Id: Idd150a65539447542df9c972b41609a68197524c

commit_message:
Do not depends on the order of the hash vars in ffu repo switching.

As vars in defined as an hash and we can't depends on the ordering
here.

Change-Id: I93fb1811aff6a5c0e5f984f8562a6cdd207f1b5c
Related-Bug: #1749338

commit_message:
Update to standalone ironic doc

This commit removes reference of need for Object Storage
service for using virtual media based iLO drivers in
standalone Ironic. One can use these drivers by setting
up web server on the host where conductor is running.
The documentation for same is available in iLO drivers
documentation page.

Change-Id: I0b0493373949e552677137ce0b6d5e44efc0268f

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration

requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id03b79421faff95cfe2ab56c626773e562c8731a
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id03b79421faff95cfe2ab56c626773e562c8731a

commit_message:
Prune conntrack calls based on actual entries

Instead of building a possibly large set of conntrack
calls to issue, try and prune it to only include those
with IP addresses in the table.

Change-Id: I0b8fe5bba02427c9fededd170224e0a7026a4440
Closes-bug: #1745468

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/ 2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I81d3a5ad484d9518d0ebaf3c8bfbe7b98b0b51ce
Closes-Bug:#1693670

[{'created': '2018-02-13 09:55:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I4d98227f4bbc6ab172b4a96c0b6f63f1e0fc375c
Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Translation is not enabled for blazar-dashboard but it is worth
fixed to avoid unnecessary problems when translation is enabled.

Change-Id: I74c741679c3f7bec28f053fc9704ff8d5bc5c536
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Use systemd module instead of command

This patch changes the use of systemctl via the command module
over to the Ansible systemd module.

One conditional check for systemd was removed since all supported
distributions deployed by OSA have systemd.

Change-Id: I926e94d185f4999e13b33f7d035b9dd5cf732f0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 18:40:42.000000000', 'message': 'Move aide db when needed

The task that moves the aide database checks to see whether aide
was just initialized, but that task has a "changed_when: false" to
help with idempotency. That means that the database never gets
moved into place.

This patch changes the task to check whether the aide
initialization was skipped or not. If it wasn't skipped, then the
database will be moved.

Closes-Bug: 1745675
Change-Id: I2f186274cbff4b38706603a51429557057843e4e
'}]
commit_message:
Move aide db when needed

The task that moves the aide database checks to see whether aide
was just initialized, but that task has a "changed_when: false" to
help with idempotency. That means that the database never gets
moved into place.

This patch changes the task to check whether the aide
initialization was skipped or not. If it wasn't skipped, then the
database will be moved.

Closes-Bug: 1745675
Change-Id: I2f186274cbff4b38706603a51429557057843e4e

commit_message:
Cleanup basic import tasks

Fix inconsistency in the way parameters were being passed
around the tasks.  It was preventing them from working
reliably.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1749461
Change-Id: I05b5fe8d99cc0f8edd89c707fd030f5bf762fe06

At this layer, it's a boolean filter; we should let the ORM
make the translation for whatever backend is in use.  MySQL
didn't care, but PostgreSQL is a bit more picky.

Co-authored-by: Scott McClymont <scott.mcclymont@verizonwireless.com>

Closes-bug: #1749297

commit_message:
Use bool instead of int for boolean filter value

At this layer, it's a boolean filter; we should let the ORM
make the translation for whatever backend is in use.  MySQL
didn't care, but PostgreSQL is a bit more picky.

Co-authored-by: Scott McClymont <scott.mcclymont@verizonwireless.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id1e5d2cec3be48f6a5164582591f2fd2f565a96b
Closes-bug: #1749297

- mos-9.0 http://ci.xrally.xyz/logs/CrtgyoUiWV/mos-9.0/ : SUCCESS (non-voting) in 19m 13s'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Charles for you fix and backports. As for stable/0.9, if it is not critical for you to backport a fix to 0.9, let's leave this branch as it. As soon as Rally 0.11 will be released (I believe it will happen today or tomorrow), Rally 0.9 will become EOL"}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:09:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Andrey.  I have stable/0.9 deployed in production for performance monitoring, so I was really hoping to get https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542304/ merged to buy  a little time to get plugins updated before moving to .11.  I'll have a look at what it will take to get the plugins updated."}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2018-02-14 22:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Disregard.  I can carry a local patch until I can move to .11.'}]

commit_message:
[DNM] Test gating on stable/0.9 branch

This commit includes a non-functional change to validate whether or not gating
works on the stable/0.9 branch.  Please do not merge.

Change-Id: I1296a7689eef659483b5dcd72db06226ed4f40f6

subject: Don't execute legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35 for doc changes
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 17:47:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't execute legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35 for doc changes

It's a waste of resources and time. For example,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528189/ took 1h+ to get CI results when
it could be just ~10 mins.

Change-Id: Ic0503d7f5ad4682bfe6909637e404a09e21e5291
"}]
commit_message:
Don't execute legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35 for doc changes

It's a waste of resources and time. For example,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528189/ took 1h+ to get CI results when
it could be just ~10 mins.

Change-Id: Ic0503d7f5ad4682bfe6909637e404a09e21e5291

commit_message:
Add osc-placement to g-r and u-c

Working on a post-test-hook change in nova
I9801ad04eedf2fede24f3eb104715dcc8e20063d which
will rely on osc-placement 1.0.0 being available
in devstack, so add it to g-r and u-c in this change.

Change-Id: I06304411c88abc2976c720dba72f96ba42d484c9

commit_message:
Add deep merge utility to helm-toolkit

Adds "helm-toolkit.utils.merge" which is a replacement for the
upstream sprig "merge" function which didn't quite do what we
wanted, specifically it didn't merge slices, it just overrode
one with the other.

Change-Id: I6402ffe043c75eb3a63797ef1be5b56f35b0adc4

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 20:19:57.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6936636e6371ccf65448f9540b39d0948c1541d4
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6936636e6371ccf65448f9540b39d0948c1541d4

The usual way of doing that is to start a mailing list thread with a subject like "[FFE][requirements][release][oslo] osprofiler bug fix needed" and explain in more detail than is given here in the commit message what bug is being fixed and why we should go ahead with the release. commit_message:
install-guide: Formatting of command

The command line used in the installation instructions is very long
and in order to copy and paste it into a terminal scrolling is
necessary. This change attempts to aid the reader by breaking the
command into several lines.

Change-Id: I26ce2c5e9ac8eade27432eae63835384b5b5e00d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-23 20:33:08.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes
all of the LXC dependencies from a deployment by leveraging things baked
into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * Two new playbooks exist to support nspawn type container deployments.
    1. nspawn-hosts-setup.yml
    2. nspawn-containers-create.yml
  * A new option `container_type` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".
  * The environment file has been modified to run the neutron network
    agents that facilitate connectivity on baremetal. The Agents that
    do not facilitate connectivity have been moved to the neutron-server
    group.
  * A new bridge has been created for test and documentation. The new
    bridge is `br-flat` and used for flat tenant networking
    connectivity. This bridge is added for two reasons, 1) many people
    are confused by the br-vlan interface and the veth pair 2) nspawn
    addresses interfaces within the container using the external
    interface name. This means we'd have a single `mv-mv-vlan` interface
    within the container and a single attachment causing either vlan
    or flat networking connectivity to break.
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely per formant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand and operate.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_host_group`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.

Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

  * A new bridge has been created for test and documentation. The new
    bridge is `br-flat` and used for flat tenant networking
    connectivity. This bridge is added for two reasons, 1) many people
    are confused by the br-vlan interface and the veth pair 2) nspawn
    addresses interfaces within the container using the external
    interface name. This means we'd have a single `mv-mv-vlan` interface
    within the container and a single attachment causing either vlan
    or flat networking connectivity to break.
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely per formant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand and operate.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_host_group`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.

Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-06-25 18:39:46.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes
all of the LXC dependencies from a deployment by leveraging things baked
into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * Two new playbooks exist to support nspawn type container deployments.
    1. nspawn-hosts-setup.yml
    2. nspawn-containers-create.yml
  * A new option `container_type` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".
  * The environment file has been modified to run the neutron network
    agents that facilitate connectivity on baremetal. The Agents that
    do not facilitate connectivity have been moved to the neutron-server
    group.
  * A new bridge has been created for test and documentation. The new
    bridge is `br-flat` and used for flat tenant networking
    connectivity. This bridge is added for two reasons, 1) many people
    are confused by the br-vlan interface and the veth pair 2) nspawn
    addresses interfaces within the container using the external
    interface name. This means we'd have a single `mv-mv-vlan` interface
    within the container and a single attachment causing either vlan
    or flat networking connectivity to break.
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely per formant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand and operate.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_host_group`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.
  * The container builds with NSPAWN are now following a JIT pattern.
    This gives us greater flexability and capabilities in terms of
    how we deploy the containers and how we build our environments.

Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-08-01 22:30:07.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes
all of the LXC dependencies from a deployment by leveraging things baked
into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * Two new playbooks exist to support nspawn type container deployments.
    1. nspawn-hosts-setup.yml
    2. nspawn-containers-create.yml
  * A new option `container_type` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".
  * The environment file has been modified to run the neutron network
    agents that facilitate connectivity on baremetal. The Agents that
    do not facilitate connectivity have been moved to the neutron-server
    group.
  * A new bridge has been created for test and documentation. The new
    bridge is `br-flat` and used for flat tenant networking
    connectivity. This bridge is added for two reasons, 1) many people
    are confused by the br-vlan interface and the veth pair 2) nspawn
    addresses interfaces within the container using the external
    interface name. This means we'd have a single `mv-mv-vlan` interface
    within the container and a single attachment causing either vlan
    or flat networking connectivity to break.
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely per formant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand and operate.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_host_group`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.
  * The container builds with NSPAWN are now following a JIT pattern.
    This gives us greater flexability and capabilities in terms of
    how we deploy the containers and how we build our environments.

Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-08-04 02:25:53.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes
all of the LXC dependencies from a deployment by leveraging things baked
into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * Two new playbooks exist to support nspawn type container deployments.
    1. nspawn-hosts-setup.yml
    2. nspawn-containers-create.yml
  * A new option `container_type` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".
  * The environment file has been modified to run the neutron network
    agents that facilitate connectivity on baremetal. The Agents that
    do not facilitate connectivity have been moved to the neutron-server
    group.
  * A new bridge has been created for test and documentation. The new
    bridge is `br-flat` and used for flat tenant networking
    connectivity. This bridge is added for two reasons, 1) many people
    are confused by the br-vlan interface and the veth pair 2) nspawn
    addresses interfaces within the container using the external
    interface name. This means we'd have a single `mv-mv-vlan` interface
    within the container and a single attachment causing either vlan
    or flat networking connectivity to break.
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely per formant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand and operate.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_host_group`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.
  * The container builds with NSPAWN are now following a JIT pattern.
    This gives us greater flexability and capabilities in terms of
    how we deploy the containers and how we build our environments.

Depends-On: I8877c244af6458ca9840ea0519ab457a726feefd
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

    connectivity. This bridge is added for two reasons, 1) many people
    are confused by the br-vlan interface and the veth pair 2) nspawn
    addresses interfaces within the container using the external
    interface name. This means we'd have a single `mv-mv-vlan` interface
    within the container and a single attachment causing either vlan
    or flat networking connectivity to break.
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely per formant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand and operate.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_host_group`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.
  * The container builds with NSPAWN are now following a JIT pattern.
    This gives us greater flexability and capabilities in terms of
    how we deploy the containers and how we build our environments.

Depends-On: I8877c244af6458ca9840ea0519ab457a726feefd
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes
all of the LXC dependencies from a deployment by leveraging things baked
into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * A new option `container_tech` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely performant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand, operate, and works with our

    new group named `nspawn_hosts`.

    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes

into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * A new option `container_tech` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".

    links have been created for the old playbook names.

  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely performant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand, operate, and works with our
    existing container interface documentation in every way.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_hosts`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.
  * The playbooks for lxc-containers have all been renamed so we have a
    consistent experience when sourcing and executing container type
    plays. To ensure this change does not break exisitng automation
    links have been created for the old playbook names.

Depends-On: I8877c244af6458ca9840ea0519ab457a726feefd
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-02 23:01:25.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This change removes
all of the LXC dependencies from a deployment by leveraging things baked
into systemd.

Notable changes:
  * A new option `container_tech` has been added. This option sets the
    container runtime within the environment. Options are "lxc", and
    "nspawn" with a default of "lxc".
  * Container networking is done using a **mac-vlan** from our normal
    integrated bridges. This keeps things extremely performant and
    flexible while also ensuring the network management of container
    interfaces is easy to understand, operate, and works with our
    existing container interface documentation in every way.
  * The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
    new group named `nspawn_hosts`.
  * All container networking on the host and within the container is
    taken care of through **systemd-networkd**. This is being done to
    ensure container deployment capabilities are platform agnostic.
  * The playbooks for lxc-containers have all been renamed so we have a
    consistent experience when sourcing and executing container type
    plays. To ensure this change does not break exisitng automation
    links have been created for the old playbook names.

Depends-On: I8877c244af6458ca9840ea0519ab457a726feefd
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-12-13 18:11:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This adds "nspawn" to
as an option to the `container_tech` variable. To support this change,
The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
new group named `nspawn_hosts`. All of the container connectivity and
setup are stored within the integrated repo under the new templates
directory.

The addition of "nspawn" container driver enables the ability for
deployers to change, or mix nspawn and lxc container technologies within
a single deployment within needing to change our well defined network
topology or storage layout.

Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-13 18:18:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add nspawn container driver

'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 23:16:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This adds "nspawn" to
as an option to the `container_tech` variable. To support this change,
The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
new group named `nspawn_hosts`. All of the container connectivity and
setup are stored within the integrated repo under the new templates
directory.

The addition of "nspawn" container driver enables the ability for
deployers to change, or mix nspawn and lxc container technologies within
a single deployment within needing to change our well defined network
topology or storage layout.

Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add nspawn container driver

This change adds an nspawn container driver which will enable deployers
to run clouds with systemd-nspawn instead of LXC. This adds "nspawn" to
as an option to the `container_tech` variable. To support this change,
The inventory generation tools have been updated to allow for a
new group named `nspawn_hosts`. All of the container connectivity and
setup are stored within the integrated repo under the new templates
directory.

The addition of "nspawn" container driver enables the ability for
deployers to change, or mix container technologies within a single
deployment without needing to change our well defined network
topology or storage layout.

Depends-On: I13d05ba8bcfe785257a9cf98dbdb6024ec937816
Change-Id: I41cfec63c423cd56a91c25dabae9aa1031c27e03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Default to docker.io instead of trunk.registry.rdoproject.org"

This reverts commit 958d374d6a662f84bfa82c1bf471b234c0698817.
This commit changed docker registry for promotion jobs, so it's
blocking all promotions now. Let's find another way to use
docker.io for patches only and rdoproject for promotions only.

Change-Id: I735380d7e68139a6faf207bd46c5495206fa804e

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 13:41:35.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

[{'created': '2018-02-14 19:24:06.000000000', 'message': "Catch APIException exceptions raised by Mistral

In the change to keystone sessions and Mistral client 3.2.0 the
exception raised when fetching an environment that doesn't exist
changed. This adds the new exception but continues to catch the previous
one.

Closes-Bug: #1749186
Change-Id: I304547b9ecabe4e387339c8561bbae8651cd9db6
(cherry picked from commit aabd6e639e81fdf56a4967098a8c0e0c0fe2fa50)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch APIException exceptions raised by Mistral

In the change to keystone sessions and Mistral client 3.2.0 the
exception raised when fetching an environment that doesn't exist
changed. This adds the new exception but continues to catch the previous
one.

Closes-Bug: #1749186
Change-Id: I304547b9ecabe4e387339c8561bbae8651cd9db6
(cherry picked from commit aabd6e639e81fdf56a4967098a8c0e0c0fe2fa50)

subject: Adding Ambari 2.4.2.0 to image gen
messages:
[{'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-12-21 00:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-21 17:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-21 19:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-22 14:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-12-29 00:18:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-12-29 13:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-24 04:48:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What's going on with this?"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> What's going on with this?

We are waiting for tosky to finish testing so we can merge"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Copying the same comment from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527524/, because it applies here too:

The story is a bit complicated. Ambari and HDP have a different versioning, and a certain version of Ambari can deploy more releases of HDP. See the matrix:
https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP2/HDP-2.6.3/bk_support-matrices/content/ch_matrices-ambari.html#ambari_stack

So far, the sahara-image-elements plugin can create
- an ambari 2.4.2.0 image which deployes HDP 2.5
- an ambari 2.2.1.0 image which deploys HDP 2.4
- an ambari 2.2.0.0 image which deploys HDP 2.3

but looking at the test matrix, it looks like we could use ambari 2.4 for everything. Or at least use the existing 2.2.1.0 to deploy also HDP 2.3 in addition of 2.4.

The point of this is to switch to 2.4.2.0 by default, and the image is built, but there are some issues with running it.
For example this:
https://community.hortonworks.com/questions/120861/ambari-agent-ssl-certificate-verify-failed-certifi.html?childToView=118105#answer-118105

We can merge the patch though and fix the issues during the weekly the way, or at least add 2.4.2.0 but not change the default (2.2.1.0).

(by the way, how can I override ambari_version from sahara-image-pack?)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-09 16:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

It seems that it works, and I can spawn both HDP 2.3 and HDP 2.4 cluster using the image based on Ambari 2.4.2.0.

Requested FFE for Queens: no risk of impact on other code.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-13 05:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Adding Ambari 2.4.2.0 to image gen

We missed ambari 2.4.2.0 on ambari image gen

Also we are disabling CA checking for Centos/RHEL because the default SSL
certificate, which is generated when the Ambari server is installed, is
invalid.

Partial-bug: #1748507
Change-Id: I272dbab4458c902af404a6365a8a43d56e4ed94e

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 jobs (almost all of them)

It defines buildimages/CLI jobs, and reuses the global pylint job
and few jobs from sahara-tests (scenario, tempest), mimicking
the existing definitions of the legacy jobs.

Still missing: grenade (there is no common grenade job yet at this
point).

Change-Id: Ibb57e216410afeef4d55d8ba2576aaacfa2f8c1a

[{'created': '2018-02-13 12:29:16.000000000', 'message': "Catch APIException exceptions raised by Mistral

commit_message:
Catch APIException exceptions raised by Mistral

In the change to keystone sessions and Mistral client 3.2.0 the
exception raised when fetching an environment that doesn't exist
changed. This adds the new exception but continues to catch the previous
one.

Closes-Bug: #1749186
Change-Id: I304547b9ecabe4e387339c8561bbae8651cd9db6

[{'created': '2018-01-15 14:54:38.000000000', 'message': "ignore compute.instance.update for metrics

nova sends *.update events in between create.start and create.end
events and it might not have a host name (which we need). in reality
to any changes to vcpus/memory/root_gb/ephemeral_gb metrics will
either send a *.resize notification and/or require a reboot which

closes-bug: #1718290

events and it might not have a host name (which we need). in reality
to any changes to vcpus/memory/root_gb/ephemeral_gb metrics will

closes-bug: #1718290

commit_message:
ignore compute.instance.update for metrics

nova sends *.update events in between create.start and create.end
events and it might not have a host name (which we need). in reality
to any changes to vcpus/memory/root_gb/ephemeral_gb metrics will
either send a *.resize notification and/or require a reboot which
sends it's own notification. because of that, just ignore
*.update notifications

Change-Id: I1f975c2d73adfc19126d70bdb1ab452e37b278fd
closes-bug: #1718290

commit_message:
Enable testing without a public network

Scenario: when the floating IP pool is not specified and
there is direct access to the private network (management
network for the Sahara cluster).

Change-Id: I19a1798790b8173d458be66bc4a28bb1cb6f970e

commit_message:
Fix the note of API version in admin doc.

Now, both V2 and V3 API support consistency groups,
incremental/force flags in backup and get-pools.

This patch corrects these nits.

doc trivial fix

Change-Id: Ic1b500dc84424593e8789f4ffed1900f3acb1c3c

subject: Expose a get_enforcer method for oslo.policy scripts
messages: [{'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-01-16 17:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-10 05:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 17:49:07.000000000', 'message': "Expose a get_enforcer method for oslo.policy scripts

Because we have policy in code, we should be able to use the
oslo.policy CLI scripts to produce sample policy files and render
complete policies based on overrides on disk. This was broken
because keystone wasn't removing unexpected commandline arguments
before passing them to oslo.config to parse. This prevented
people from generating complete policy files like they would for
horizon.

This commit exposes a get_enforcer() that substitutes an empty list
in place of arguments passed in through the system. This makes it
so that oslo.config doesn't choke when processing configuration
values.

Change-Id: I22583258eac5b3a64208355d18ccfa62dba1871d
Closes-Bug: 1740951
(cherry picked from commit 85c957c50387ca47b68bc412879c753e7618f86b)
"}]
commit_message:
Expose a get_enforcer method for oslo.policy scripts

Because we have policy in code, we should be able to use the
oslo.policy CLI scripts to produce sample policy files and render
complete policies based on overrides on disk. This was broken
because keystone wasn't removing unexpected commandline arguments
before passing them to oslo.config to parse. This prevented
people from generating complete policy files like they would for
horizon.

This commit exposes a get_enforcer() that substitutes an empty list
in place of arguments passed in through the system. This makes it
so that oslo.config doesn't choke when processing configuration
values.

Change-Id: I22583258eac5b3a64208355d18ccfa62dba1871d
Closes-Bug: 1740951
(cherry picked from commit 85c957c50387ca47b68bc412879c753e7618f86b)

commit_message:
Add New in Pike note to using db_sync check

This change adds a note (*New in Pike*) to the section for running
db_sync --check to clarify which release this feature was added. This
is similar to other sections in this document that specify the release
that a feature was added in and when it is available.

Change-Id: I7d778fa249997bb24e4563d6960910b93637bbf2
Closes-Bug: #1734549
(cherry picked from commit 756d28149043f298ba25c654e1ef31d7e690c909)

(https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest), but it declares

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 00:39:00.000000000', 'message': "Handle tags in infra docs publishing

We publish docs for infra projects on tags for projects like bindep.
Previously the afs publishing role for this assumed zuul.branch was
always going to be present but it isn't when operating on a tag in the
release pipeline. Update the conditionals to properly handle the case of
zuul.tag being present and zuul.branch missing.

Change-Id: Iee2a7f43a92a63c1943755ff46a03c94f096d6bc
"}]
commit_message:
Handle tags in infra docs publishing

We publish docs for infra projects on tags for projects like bindep.
Previously the afs publishing role for this assumed zuul.branch was
always going to be present but it isn't when operating on a tag in the
release pipeline. Update the conditionals to properly handle the case of
zuul.tag being present and zuul.branch missing.

Change-Id: Iee2a7f43a92a63c1943755ff46a03c94f096d6bc
