messages:
[{'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2018-02-13 17:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2018-02-13 18:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Error: Package: python2-sphinxcontrib-programoutput-0.8-6.el7.noarch (delorean-queens-testing)
          Requires: js-jquery

Without that package sphinx fails with: Could not import extension sphinxcontrib.programoutput (exception: No module named programoutput)'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-02-14 08:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, I found what that is. We don't package js-jquery in RDO because it pulls a lot of node.js dependencies. We could enable doc building for RDO by adding these two lines in %prep (and making the sphinxcontrib-programoutput only for non-RDO):


sed -i '/sphinxcontrib.programoutput/d' doc/source/conf.py
sed -i '/sphinx.ext.autosectionlabel/d' doc/source/conf.py

If it's too hacky, let's just leave doc building disabled in RDO."}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2018-02-14 12:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

a nit in one comment, but LGTM'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove admin_token_auth steps from install guide

The installation guide previously listed this as a step but
it is no longer needed since `admin_token_auth` is no longer in the
paste file by default

Change-Id: If36bafbecd657c3acd769f11636a1d844be0ac66
Closes-Bug: 1716797
(cherry picked from commit 5194a369613588fb805450e9288ee636cfbcaf8f)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I680e12ba32a72d56536de04f542900dface4aeda

> (1 comment)

Indeed, it is because we haven't promoted in a long time.

Once we have package promotion we also get Ironic Change-Id: I7841d59c3590106dd8ac7e625a9db7b47674fe29. Without triplo Change-Id: I8e192df9068c3f5d6657f5ea92e7e2f44646c290 the tripleo undercloud will not work.

So I figured this would be a way to allow the change to land in instack-undercloud.

I guess options are to wait for package promote, or do this to land I8e192df9068c3f5d6657f5ea92e7e2f44646c290 now. And then revert this change later."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:46:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Once verified, the adjustment should probably also be reflected back.  As noted when I prepared the other exceptions.txt entries, I strongly believe that we\'ve several names ordered Eastern style, rather than Western style, and I\'m uncertain that changing one name from Eastern to Western is the best solution without further discussion.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-02-12 19:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-02-12 19:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-14 18:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector

Spec: TripleO Ironic Inspector changes to support routed networks

This spec implements the blueprint to implement Ironic Inspector
for routed subnets. A DHCP relay is configured on the L3 switches,
and dnsmasq replies with an IP from the correct subnet. In order
for this to work, changes will have to be made to the Puppet
scripts that configure Ironic Inspector.

Note that this spec does not cover general use of Ironic
Inspector over routed networks for tenant bare metal use. That
will be covered by another blueprint which uses Neutron
integration, which is not required here.

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I3c983d66fffbdbaa03ed1692fd77c95cd6c15abf

subject: Expose bug in /role_assignments API with system-scope
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/968696 to bug/1748970'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-14 07:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 21:40:57.000000000', 'message': 'Expose bug in /role_assignments API with system-scope

The role_assignment API supports a bunch of query parameters that
gives users flexibility when querying for role assignments. This
commit exposes an issue when querying keystone for a specific role
using /role_assignments?role.id={role_id}. The expected result was
that the returned list would only contain role assignments for that
specific role ID. The actual result is a set of role assignments with
that role ID and all system role assignments.

This caused issues in tempest because tempest goes through and cleans
up resources using `tearDownClass`, and it is common to remove
specific roles used in the test class. The problem is that keystone
queries the role assignment API for all role assignment with a
specific role ID, which is the equivalent to
`GET /v3/role_assignments?role.id={role_id}` when deleting a role. The
list returned included false positives, which were system role
assignments, resulting in revocation events getting persisted for
users in those role assignments. This prevented the administrator in
tempest from cleaning up the rest of the resources because the
revocation event would make the token being used to do resource
cleanup.

This commit exposes the bug using tests.

Change-Id: If93400be3c9d3fe8e266bb36c16accca93d77154
Partial-Bug: 1748970
(cherry picked from commit a226a3d8be5ba720f149606a84df0432ec4858c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Expose bug in /role_assignments API with system-scope

The role_assignment API supports a bunch of query parameters that
gives users flexibility when querying for role assignments. This
commit exposes an issue when querying keystone for a specific role
using /role_assignments?role.id={role_id}. The expected result was
that the returned list would only contain role assignments for that
specific role ID. The actual result is a set of role assignments with
that role ID and all system role assignments.

This caused issues in tempest because tempest goes through and cleans
up resources using `tearDownClass`, and it is common to remove
specific roles used in the test class. The problem is that keystone
queries the role assignment API for all role assignment with a
specific role ID, which is the equivalent to
`GET /v3/role_assignments?role.id={role_id}` when deleting a role. The
list returned included false positives, which were system role
assignments, resulting in revocation events getting persisted for
users in those role assignments. This prevented the administrator in
tempest from cleaning up the rest of the resources because the
revocation event would make the token being used to do resource
cleanup.

This commit exposes the bug using tests.

Change-Id: If93400be3c9d3fe8e266bb36c16accca93d77154
Partial-Bug: 1748970
(cherry picked from commit a226a3d8be5ba720f149606a84df0432ec4858c7)

subject: Expose bug in system assignment when deleting groups
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-14 07:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 21:45:17.000000000', 'message': "Expose bug in system assignment when deleting groups

Project and domain role assignment are cleaned up when deleting
groups. This commit introduces a test case that shows this isn't the
case for system role assignments. A subsequent patch will implement
a fix to make sure system role assignments are removed when groups
are deleted, to be consistent with project and domain assignments.

Change-Id: I9b452aff144fd8867cdac2f44cbcaa0d1de63a12
Partial-Bug: 1749267
(cherry picked from commit 3fa997531f757a832aab209d585bb98503e72cc2)
"}]
commit_message:
Expose bug in system assignment when deleting groups

Project and domain role assignment are cleaned up when deleting
groups. This commit introduces a test case that shows this isn't the
case for system role assignments. A subsequent patch will implement
a fix to make sure system role assignments are removed when groups
are deleted, to be consistent with project and domain assignments.

Change-Id: I9b452aff144fd8867cdac2f44cbcaa0d1de63a12
Partial-Bug: 1749267
(cherry picked from commit 3fa997531f757a832aab209d585bb98503e72cc2)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I02a7d9b9b24ce72e8fd1ab3e183be38bf583e117
